original: pags shun la yod pa zhes bya ba ni pags shun dang 'dra bas pags shun la gnas pa ltar dus dang 'bad pa nyung du zhig gis spong bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: pags shun la yod pa zhes bya ba ni pags shun dang 'dra bas pags shun la gnas pa ltar dus dang 'bad pa nyung du zhig gis spong bar nus pa'o //

analyzed: pri la yod pa lta bu ni dus dang 'bad pa 'bring gis spong bar nus pa'o //

analyzed: snyid bo la yod pa lta bu ni dus ring por 'bad pa chen pos spang bar bya'o /

original: @301b des ni gnas pa gsum la dus chen po nyid dang / 'bad pa chen po nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @301b des ni gnas pa gsum la dus chen po nyid dang / 'bad pa chen po nyid bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de spangs ma thag nyid du de'i gnyen po'i ye shes 'thob par bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i gnas pa rnams ni zhugs pa'i lam du rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: de ma yin pa'i gnas pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: gnas pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par yang dag pas bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gnas pa gcu gsum po de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: on these thirteen stations.üîΩThese eleven purifications should be understood in brief as threefold:üîΩinitial,

analyzed: rnam par dag pa bcu gcig po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar rig par bya'o //

analyzed: rigs nyid rnam par dag pa ni rigs rnam par dag pa ste /

analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa gsum la ni ye shes la kun du rtsom pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir ro //

original: rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i gnas pa la ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i gnas pa la ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /

original: de'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i gnas pa ni rnam pa thams cad du tshig gi don thams cad ston pa'i phyir so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par dag pa'o//

original: @302a * // gnas pa mchog la ni rnam pa thams cad du shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas shes bya thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //

translated: In order to demonstrate the removal of suffering and mental dissatisfaction,

original: de dag na ba'am mi dga' bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag na ba'am mi dga' bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúwhether they are sick or unhappy. ‚Äù

original: brnyas par mi bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brnyas par mi bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should not despise others,

original: dman pa la yang brnyas par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa la yang brnyas par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúone does not despise even the lowly. ‚Äù

original: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa rab tu sbyin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa rab tu sbyin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the bestowal of instruction and counsel,

original: dus dus su de dag la skyo ba dang du blangs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus dus su de dag la skyo ba dang du blangs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúfrom time to time, one should take up their sorrows and joys. ‚Äù

original: gzhan dag gis brgal ba na rnam par brtags nas mi brjed par rjes su mthun pa'i @306b lan 'debs shing mi 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brgal ba na rnam par brtags nas mi brjed par rjes su mthun pa'i @306b lan 'debs shing mi 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: When others dispute, one should respond with an appropriate reply after having examined the matter.

original: tshul dang spyod pa mthun pa'i don mthun pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul dang spyod pa mthun pa'i don mthun pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of being a companion with whom one can share both joy and sorrow,

original: dman par yang mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dman par yang mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúone does not treat them with contempt. ‚Äù

original: brten pa med par 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brten pa med par 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the absence of dependence,üîΩhe says, ‚Äúone does not become dependent on them. ‚Äù

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and also for the sake of gain and honor.

original: tshig lhag ma rnams kyis ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba dag gis nges par 'jug pa bstan pa yin no //üîΩyongs su 'dzin pa'i nye bar bzung nas gcig tu 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: tshig lhag ma rnams kyis ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba dag gis nges par 'jug pa bstan pa yin no // yongs su 'dzin pa'i nye bar bzung nas gcig tu 'dzin pa'am /
translated: The remaining phrases show the engagement through the resolve and the application.üîΩHe does not take up a position as to whether or not he takes up a position with regard to the appropriation.

original: gcig tu mi 'dzin par 'jug pa yang 'gog par byed do zhes bya bar /
analyzed: gcig tu mi 'dzin par 'jug pa yang 'gog par byed do zhes bya bar /
translated: He does not take up a position as to whether or not he does not take up a position.

original: yongs su 'dzin par mi byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par mi byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He does not take up a position as to whether or not he does not take up a position.

original: gang gi tshe gdul bya gdul dka' ba bdag nyid kyis 'dul bar mi nus pa de'i tshe rang sangs rgyas bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir 'khor yongs su 'dzin par mi byed do //üîΩmi 'dzin par mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi 'dzin par yang mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gdul bya gdul dka' ba bdag nyid kyis 'dul bar mi nus pa de'i tshe rang sangs rgyas bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir 'khor yongs su 'dzin par mi byed do // mi 'dzin par mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi 'dzin par yang mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the disciples are difficult to train and he is not able to train them himself, then, like the pratyekabuddhas, he does not take up a following in order to abandon the afflictions.üîΩIn order to show that he does not not take up a following, he says, ‚ÄúHe does not not take up a position.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa ma yin par mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that he does not take up a position as to whether or not he takes up a position, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúHe does not take up a position as to whether or not he takes up a position.‚Äù

original: gzhan du yang mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: nor does he do it to others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gis 'ga' zhig yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'di dag kho nar nges pa yin zhes bya bar /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gis 'ga' zhig yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'di dag kho nar nges pa yin zhes bya bar /
translated: The bodhisattvas who do take on disciples are certain to do so in these very ways.

original: de ltar na rnam pa drug po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa drug po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, these six kinds are called the bodhisattvas who take on disciples.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pa rnams yongs su 'dzin pa la zhugs par gyur pa na gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad par gyur pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang yongs su 'dzin pa la zhugs par gyur pa na gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad parüîΩ'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pa rnams yongs su 'dzin pa la zhugs par gyur pa na gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad par gyur pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang yongs su 'dzin pa la zhugs par gyur pa na gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as worldly people who take on disciples encounter harm and misfortune, so also the bodhisattvas who take on disciples encounter harm and misfortune.

original: khyad par ni 'di yod de 'di dag ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa na kun du rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yod de 'di dag ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa na kun du rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But there is this difference: worldly people, when they encounter harm and misfortune, become confused.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni yang mkhas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbcos pa'i thabs tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni yang mkhas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbcos pa'i thabs tshol bar byed do //
translated: But the bodhisattvas, being wise, seek a remedy.

original: gnod pa yang de yin la nyam nga yang de yin pa'am /
analyzed: gnod pa yang de yin la nyam nga yang de yin pa'am /
translated: It is a calamity and also a misfortune.

original: yang na gnod pa dang nyam nga ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba ste /
analyzed: yang na gnod pa dang nyam nga ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba ste /
translated: Or, calamity and misfortune are a calamity and misfortune.

original: gnyis ka'i phyogs kyi tshul gyis de byas sam ma byas na yang skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: gnyis ka'i phyogs kyi tshul gyis de byas sam ma byas na yang skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ;
translated: Because it is a fault whether or not one does it, in terms of both alternatives.

original: gnod cing nyam nga ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnod cing nyam nga ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is called a calamity and misfortune.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' phyogs gnyis ka'i tshul la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' phyogs gnyis ka'i tshul la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva should be skilled in the method of the two alternatives.

original: de'i tshe rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba nyams su blang ba la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba nyams su blang ba la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: At that time, he should be skilled in the practice of the action that is suitable to himself. This is the meaning.

original: sems can la gnod pa byed pa spong ba'i sgo nas btang snyoms su @307a * //üîΩ'jog pa yang tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa la /
analyzed: sems can la gnod pa byed pa spong ba'i sgo nas btang snyoms su @307a * // 'jog pa yang tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa la /
translated: It is not proper to remain indifferent by avoiding harming sentient beings.

original: gzhan la gnod pa byed pa yang de dang 'dra bas de ltar na dngos po gcig la bya ba yang yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa byed pa yang de dang 'dra bas de ltar na dngos po gcig la bya ba yang yin la /
translated: It is the same with harming others. Thus, it is an action in one thing,üîΩbut it is not an action in another.

original: mi bya ba yang yin pa ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi bya ba yang yin pa ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand also what should not be done‚Äù refers to harm and distress.

original: de lta bu la thabs la mkhas par 'gyur bar bya ste ;
analyzed: de lta bu la thabs la mkhas par 'gyur bar bya ste ;
translated: One should be skilled in means with regard to such situations.

original: de la gnod pa byas pas bya ba ma yin pa las kyang bzlog par bya la /
analyzed: de la gnod pa byas pas bya ba ma yin pa las kyang bzlog par bya la /
translated: One should turn away from what should not be done because of the harm that it causes.

original: shin tu gnod par yang mi bya ba la yang thabs la mkhas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu gnod par yang mi bya ba la yang thabs la mkhas par bya ba'o //
translated: One should also be skilled in means with regard to what should not be done because it causes great harm.

original: sbyor ba drag po yang kun du spyod pa ni gnod pa yin la bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa bsrung bar bya dgos pa ni nyam nga ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba drag po yang kun du spyod pa ni gnod pa yin la bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa bsrung bar bya dgos pa ni nyam nga ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúharm and distress‚Äù means that one should not engage in any kind of violent action.

original: 'dir ni lci ba dang / yang ba yongs su brtags la thabs la mkhas pas btang snyoms su bya zhing sems kyi g-yeng ba bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni lci ba dang / yang ba yongs su brtags la thabs la mkhas pas btang snyoms su bya zhing sems kyi g-yeng ba bzlog par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should be indifferent toward them by means of skill in means after having examined their relative importance. One should also turn away from any distraction of mind.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe object to be given is small‚Äù means that the object to be given is small.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i chos ni nyung ngu zhig la de la don du gnyer ba ni mang du lhags la /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i chos ni nyung ngu zhig la de la don du gnyer ba ni mang du lhags la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbut many petitioners have come‚Äù means that many petitioners have come.

original: gal te gcig la byin na ni gzhan gyi sems mi dga' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te gcig la byin na ni gzhan gyi sems mi dga' bar 'gyur la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif I give to one, the others will be displeased‚Äù means that if one gives to one petitioner, the others will be displeased.

original: 'on te thams cad la byin na ni chung bas sbyin gyi mi long bas ma byin na yang byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te thams cad la byin na ni chung bas sbyin gyi mi long bas ma byin na yang byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: But if he gives to all, then because of his poverty, it is not in accord with the bodhisattva‚Äôs vow not to give to the one who does not beg.

original: de lta bu ni nyam nga ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni nyam nga ba yin no //
translated: This is the dilemma.

original: des na 'dir gang zag rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: des na 'dir gang zag rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
translated: So here we must analyze the person.

original: don du gnyer ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mgon med pa dang skyabs med pa dag la sbyin par bya zhing /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mgon med pa dang skyabs med pa dag la sbyin par bya zhing /
translated: One should give to those who are in need, to those who are suffering, to those who are without protector or refuge.

original: gzhan dag gi rjes su mthun pas bzod par byas la gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi rjes su mthun pas bzod par byas la gtang bar bya'o //
translated: But one should give after having gained the consent of others, and not in a way that is disagreeable to them.

original: de ni gcig pu yin la zhes bya ba ni bdag ni grogs med pa gcig pu yin zhing mthun yang med la /
analyzed: de ni gcig pu yin la zhes bya ba ni bdag ni grogs med pa gcig pu yin zhing mthun yang med la /
translated: ‚ÄúHe is alone‚Äù means that one is alone without a companion, without a friend.

original: gcig cig gi grogs byas na ni mang po dag mi dga' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gcig cig gi grogs byas na ni mang po dag mi dga' bar 'gyur la /
translated: If one helps one person, many others will be displeased.

original: thams cad kyi grogs bya ba'i nus pa yang med pas /
analyzed: thams cad kyi grogs bya ba'i nus pa yang med pas /
translated: And one is not able to help everyone.

original: kha cig gi yang grogs mi bya ba yang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pas de'i phyir gnod pa dang nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig gi yang grogs mi bya ba yang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pas de'i phyir gnod pa dang nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: It is not in accord with the way of the bodhisattva to not help even one who is a friend. Therefore, it is a misfortune and a calamity.

original: 'dir yang lci ba dang yang ba la btang snyoms su bya ba'am /üîΩnus pa yod pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir yang lci ba dang yang ba la btang snyoms su bya ba'am / nus pa yod pa'am /
translated: Here, one should be indifferent to the heavy and the light,

original: nus pa med pa'i gang zag rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i gang zag rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: or one should analyze the person who is able or unable.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba ni dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba ni dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word wholesome is a synonym for pure.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dge ba ma bskyed na yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i mthu med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dge ba ma bskyed na yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i mthu med par 'gyur la /
translated: If one does not generate wholesome meditative attainment, one will lack the power to ripen the qualities of a Buddha, etc.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed na yang bag med pa'i gnas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed na yang bag med pa'i gnas su 'gyur te /
translated: If one generates meditative attainment, it will become a basis for heedlessness.

original: de'i ro myangs pas dbang ma thob pa rnams @307b lha'i 'jig rten du skye par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ro myangs pas dbang ma thob pa rnams @307b lha'i 'jig rten du skye par 'gyur ro //
translated: By savoring its taste, those who have not attained mastery will be reborn in the world of the gods.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sems las su mi rung ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems las su mi rung ba ni gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind that is not serviceable is one that encounters harm and distress.

original: des na 'dir bstan pa la dmigs pa 'jug par bya ste /üîΩgnyen po'i phyogs kyi rgyu gang gis ro myang ba de spong bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: des na 'dir bstan pa la dmigs pa 'jug par bya ste / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rgyu gang gis ro myang ba de spong bar byed pa'am /
translated: Therefore, one should apply oneself to the object that is taught here.

original: yang na gnas de nas myur du 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i thabs byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gnas de nas myur du 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i thabs byed pa'o //
translated: By means of the cause that is the counteragent, one should abandon that relishing or one should employ the means to quickly die from that state.

original: sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod la zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don ni byed par 'dod la lus nyam chung ba la sogs pa'i rgyus de byed par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod la zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don ni byed par 'dod la lus nyam chung ba la sogs pa'i rgyus de byed par mi nus pa'o //
translated: One who desires to act on behalf of sentient beings is one who desires to act on behalf of sentient beings but is unable to do so because of the weakness of the body, etc.

original: de la ni yang dag pa'i smon lam gdab par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de la ni yang dag pa'i smon lam gdab par bya ba'am /
translated: In this case, one should make a correct aspirational prayer or

original: so sor rtogs pa drag po nye bar gzhag nas skyo ba med par brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor rtogs pa drag po nye bar gzhag nas skyo ba med par brtsam par bya'o //
translated: one should undertake the task without weariness, having established intense discernment.

original: blun po ste blo dman pa rnams la chos ston pa yang shin tu dka' ba dang / g-yon can de bzhin du zhugs par 'gyur ba nyid dang / dmu rgod de tshig ngan par smra ba nyid la ni bstan yang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: blun po ste blo dman pa rnams la chos ston pa yang shin tu dka' ba dang / g-yon can de bzhin du zhugs par 'gyur ba nyid dang / dmu rgod de tshig ngan par smra ba nyid la ni bstan yang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir dang /
translated: And it is not appropriate to teach the Dharma to the deceitful, the violent, and the wicked, because they will not be receptive to the teaching, and because the teaching will be fruitless.

original: btang snyoms su gnas pa yang rjes su mthun pa ma yin na ji ltar bya ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms su gnas pa yang rjes su mthun pa ma yin na ji ltar bya ste /
translated: So what should be done?

original: 'dir yang so sor rtogs pa'i stobs kyis blun po la ni rim gyis skyo ba med par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang so sor rtogs pa'i stobs kyis blun po la ni rim gyis skyo ba med par bya'o //
translated: Here, by the power of discernment, one should gradually generate disgust in the fool.

original: g-yon can dang dmu rgod la ni btang snyoms nyid du gnas pa'o //üîΩ'khor ba'i nyes dmigs mthong bas 'khor ba yongs su gtong ba'i sgo nas ni theg pa dman par lhung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: g-yon can dang dmu rgod la ni btang snyoms nyid du gnas pa'o // 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs mthong bas 'khor ba yongs su gtong ba'i sgo nas ni theg pa dman par lhung bar 'gyur la /
translated: And one should remain indifferent to the deceitful and the violent.üîΩBy seeing the faults of cyclic existence, one should abandon cyclic existence.

original: skyon med par mthong ba las ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i bsam pa med pas 'khor ba mi gtong ba nyid do //
analyzed: skyon med par mthong ba las ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i bsam pa med pas 'khor ba mi gtong ba nyid do //
translated: But by seeing the faults of nirvana, one should not abandon cyclic existence, because one has no intention of going to nirvana.

original: de'i phyir gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod cing nyam nga ba dang phrad pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is a calamity and a misfortune to encounter the opportunity to practice.

original: 'dir yang thabs la mkhas pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang thabs la mkhas pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Here, one should cultivate skill in means.

original: shes rab la brten nas ni 'khor ba'i skyon mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab la brten nas ni 'khor ba'i skyon mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: On the basis of wisdom, one sees the faults of cyclic existence.

original: snying rje la brten nas ni 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: snying rje la brten nas ni 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: On the basis of compassion, one does not abandon cyclic existence.

original: bsam pa ma dag pa rnams la ni rmongs bzhin du 'ching bar 'gyur bas 'chi ba de ni gnod cing nyam nga ba ste /
analyzed: bsam pa ma dag pa rnams la ni rmongs bzhin du 'ching bar 'gyur bas 'chi ba de ni gnod cing nyam nga ba ste /
translated: For those whose intention is impure, death is a misfortune, because they die bound as if in a stupor.

original: sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod pa la nus pa'i nges pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid yongs su smin par bya ba la yang nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod pa la nus pa'i nges pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid yongs su smin par bya ba la yang nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they do not see the certainty of ability to act for the welfare of sentient beings, and because they do not see the certainty of their own maturity.

original: 'dir ni brtson 'grus shin tu 'bar ba brtsam par bya ba'am dran pa brjed pa med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam rgya chen po gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni brtson 'grus shin tu 'bar ba brtsam par bya ba'am dran pa brjed pa med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam rgya chen po gdab par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should make vast aspirational prayers in order to begin the blazing of effort or to attain the absence of forgetfulness.

original: bsam pa rnam par ma dag pa ni sdug pa'i dngos po gtang bar bya ba mi nus pa yin la /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par ma dag pa ni sdug pa'i dngos po gtang bar bya ba mi nus pa yin la /
translated: The impure intention is the inability to give up a desirable object.

original: ma byin na yang tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma byin na yang tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: But if one does not give, it is not proper.

original: @308a * // des na gnod cing nyam nga ba yin te /
analyzed: @308a * // des na gnod cing nyam nga ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is harmful and dangerous.

original: der ni sems nges par spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: der ni sems nges par spro bar bya'o //
translated: One should be determined to give there.

original: bsam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa rnams phan tshun 'dod pa tha dad pa dang / mos pa yang tha dad pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyi mos pa sna tshogs pa rnams la 'dod pa'i mos pa bskyed pa'i phyir go bar bya ba ni dka' ba dang /
analyzed: bsam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa rnams phan tshun 'dod pa tha dad pa dang / mos pa yang tha dad pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyi mos pa sna tshogs pa rnams la 'dod pa'i mos pa bskyed pa'i phyir go bar bya ba ni dka' ba dang /
translated: It is difficult to understand the various different intentions of various different desires and various different inclinations of various different people.

original: de lta na yang btang snyoms su gnas par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang btang snyoms su gnas par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But even so, it is not proper to remain indifferent,

original: nges par bstan par bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par bstan par bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is necessary to teach them.

original: de'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis brtan par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis brtan par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should remain firm by the power of discernment.

original: shin tu bag yod par bya ba la goms par byas na nyon mongs pa spong bar thal bar 'gyur bas de la thabs la mkhas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu bag yod par bya ba la goms par byas na nyon mongs pa spong bar thal bar 'gyur bas de la thabs la mkhas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Since it follows that afflictions are abandoned by cultivating great conscientiousness, one should cultivate skill in means.

original: gnod pa dang nyam nga ba dang phrad par gyur pa na ni de dang 'tsham pa'i dngos po brgyad la nan tan gyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa dang nyam nga ba dang phrad par gyur pa na ni de dang 'tsham pa'i dngos po brgyad la nan tan gyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: When one encounters harm and misfortune, one should practice the eight things that are appropriate.

original: de ltar na yang dag pa'i gnyen po la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa'i gnyen po la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, one becomes skilled in the correct antidotes.

original: des na gnod pa dang nyam nga bas 'khrugs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gnod pa dang nyam nga bas 'khrugs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one is not disturbed by harm and misfortune.

original: des na bdag nyid yang dag par 'dren par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bdag nyid yang dag par 'dren par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one becomes a true leader.

original: des na gnod pa dang nyam nga bas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gnod pa dang nyam nga bas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one is not harmed by harm and misfortune.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las yongs su 'dzin pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las yongs su 'dzin pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the second chapter, the chapter on embracing, from the Bodhisattva Section of the Bodhisattva Levels.

original: // / de ltar na sems can yongs su 'dzin pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi don yang dag par bstan pas mdor bstan to //
analyzed: // / de ltar na sems can yongs su 'dzin pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi don yang dag par bstan pas mdor bstan to //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas who are engaged in the protection of sentient beings are indicated in brief by the teaching of the meaning of the distinctions of their states.

original: 'dren ma gcig ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dren ma gcig ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: One is mixed, that is, of the bodhisattvas and the TathƒÅgatas.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang yin la /
translated: It is that of the bodhisattvas

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang yin no //
translated: and also that of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: sa 'di dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni skal ba dang mnyam pa nyid dang / mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / nges pa'i sa la zhugs pa dang / nges pa'i spyod pa la zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: sa 'di dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni skal ba dang mnyam pa nyid dang / mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / nges pa'i sa la zhugs pa dang / nges pa'i spyod pa la zhugs pa dang /
translated: The establishment of these stages is from the point of view of the sameness of fortune, the application to realization, realization, the entry into the stage of certainty, the entry into the practice of certainty,

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: and the arrival at the ultimate.

original: yang na skal ba dang ldan pa bskal pa grangs med pas nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du byas nas sa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na skal ba dang ldan pa bskal pa grangs med pas nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du byas nas sa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Or else, the stages are to be arranged in terms of the fortune for definite emergence and the application to definite emergence in three incalculable eons.

original: rigs kyis la gnas pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs kyis la gnas pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: One who is situated in the lineage has the fortune for definite emergence.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa ni bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos nges par @308b 'byung ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa ni bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos nges par @308b 'byung ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The stage of action in faith is the application to definite emergence in the first incalculable eon.

original: bsam pa dag pa'i sa ni de'i nges par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa'i sa ni de'i nges par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The stage of pure universal responsibility is the definite emergence.

original: spyod pa la zhugs pa'i sa ni grangs med pa gnyis pa'i sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: spyod pa la zhugs pa'i sa ni grangs med pa gnyis pa'i sbyor ba yin la /
translated: The stage of engagement through belief is the application to the second incalculable eon.

original: nges pa'i sa ni de'i nges par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i sa ni de'i nges par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The stage of certainty is the definite emergence.

original: nges pa'i sa la spyod pa ni grangs med pa gsum pa'i sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: nges pa'i sa la spyod pa ni grangs med pa gsum pa'i sbyor ba yin la /
translated: The practice of the stage of certainty is the application to the third incalculable eon.

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa ni de'i nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa ni de'i nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The stage of going to the end is the definite emergence.

original: de'i phyir sa bdun po yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bdun po yin no //
translated: Therefore, there are seven stages.

original: de dag las gsum ni gnas pa dang po gsum yin no //
analyzed: de dag las gsum ni gnas pa dang po gsum yin no //
translated: Three of these are the first three abodes.

original: de nas gnas pa drug ni sa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gnas pa drug ni sa bzhi pa'o //
translated: Then, the six abodes are the fourth stage.

original: mtshan ma med par lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas pa ni sa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas pa ni sa lnga pa'o //
translated: The effortless abode of signlessness is the fifth stage.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i gnas pa ni sa drug pa'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i gnas pa ni sa drug pa'o //
translated: The abode of analytical discernment is the sixth stage.

original: gnas pa mchog dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ni sa bdun pa ste /üîΩda ltar nas dang gnas pa dag phan tshun bsdus par bstan nas /
analyzed: gnas pa mchog dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ni sa bdun pa ste / da ltar nas dang gnas pa dag phan tshun bsdus par bstan nas /
translated: The supreme abode and the tathagata abode are the seventh stage.üîΩHaving taught the mutual inclusion of the abodes and stages, in order to teach the path of perfect transcendence of lower realms, which is stated as follows:

original: sngar bstan pa'i sa dang po thob pa nyid nas ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin zhes bya ba'i ngan 'gro las yang dag par 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i sa dang po thob pa nyid nas ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin zhes bya ba'i ngan 'gro las yang dag par 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: From the attainment of the first stage, one perfectly transcends the fear of lower realms,

original: yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: the perfectly pure fourth dhyana is twofold:

original: pha rol tu phyin par gtogs par bsdus pa'i phyir dang / mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsal pos rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin par gtogs par bsdus pa'i phyir dang / mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsal pos rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is included in the perfection of wisdom, and because it is distinguished by the clarity of unshakable concentration.

original: gzhan yid la mi byed par zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩsems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yid la mi byed par zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par zhes bstan pa yin no // sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Not attending to others means that it is taught to be uninterrupted.

original: snying brtse ba sgom par byed de /
analyzed: snying brtse ba sgom par byed de /
translated: He cultivates compassion in order to accomplish the benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: de bsgoms pas de dang mthun pa'i snying rje'i bsam pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bsgoms pas de dang mthun pa'i snying rje'i bsam pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By cultivating that, he also attains the compassionate attitude that is in accord with it.

original: bsam pa gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du ngan song rnam pa gsum ni gnas pa yang rang gi khyim na gnas pa dang 'dra bar gnas te /
analyzed: bsam pa gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du ngan song rnam pa gsum ni gnas pa yang rang gi khyim na gnas pa dang 'dra bar gnas te /
translated: By that attitude, he dwells in the three lower realms for the sake of sentient beings, as if he were dwelling in his own home.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa zhen pa'i khyim pa dag rang gi khyim na gnas par dga' ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa rnams ngan song du gnas par dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa zhen pa'i khyim pa dag rang gi khyim na gnas par dga' ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa rnams ngan song du gnas par dga' ba yin te /
translated: Just as householders who are attached to desire enjoy dwelling in their own homes, so bodhisattvas who are engaged in benefiting sentient beings enjoy dwelling in the lower realms.

original: sems can thams cad kyi ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'i las ci byas pa de thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa bdag gis myang bar bya'o zhes mos par byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'i las ci byas pa de thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa bdag gis myang bar bya'o zhes mos par byed do //
translated: One should imagine, I will experience the full ripening of whatever karma all sentient beings have created that would cause them to be born in the lower realms.

original: de ltar bsam pa dang mos pa'i khyad par bstan nas /üîΩsbyor ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i las thams cad gtan kun du mi @309a * //
analyzed: de ltar bsam pa dang mos pa'i khyad par bstan nas / sbyor ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i las thams cad gtan kun du mi @309a * //
translated: Having explained the differences in attitude and imagination in this way,üîΩin order to explain the difference in application, it says,

original: spyod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: spyod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One does not engage in any non-virtuous karma at all, ever.

original: ngan song gi rgyu'i mi dge ba rnams ji ltar yang kun du mi spyod pa de ltar sems mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: ngan song gi rgyu'i mi dge ba rnams ji ltar yang kun du mi spyod pa de ltar sems mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: One forms the mind in such a way that one does not engage in any non-virtuous karma that is the cause of the lower realms.

original: ji ltar sngar bstan pa'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byas pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan yongs su rdzogs par byas pas gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar bstan pa'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byas pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan yongs su rdzogs par byas pas gnas ngan len spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By perfecting the attitude taught above and perfecting the pure meditative stabilization, the negative tendencies are eliminated.üîΩIn order to show that one transforms like gold ore that has been well smelted,

original: gser gyi khams yod pa'i sems legs par bzhus pa bzhin du yongs su 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gser gyi khams yod pa'i sems legs par bzhus pa bzhin du yongs su 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it says,

original: ngan song du 'gro ba'i las gtan mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro ba'i las gtan mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: He never performs actions that lead to the miserable realms.

original: ngan song du 'gro ba la sogs pa dang mthun pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro ba la sogs pa dang mthun pa yang ma yin la /
translated: He is not even compatible with going to the miserable realms, etc.

original: ngan song gi phung po bskyed pa dang mthun pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song gi phung po bskyed pa dang mthun pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: He is not even compatible with the production of the aggregates of the miserable realms.

original: de lta bu'i gnas yongs su gyur pas mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas ngan song du 'gro pa las 'das nas bsam pa dag pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas yongs su gyur pas mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas ngan song du 'gro pa las 'das nas bsam pa dag pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of such a transformation of the basis, having transcended going to the miserable realms from the stage of action out of faith, he enters the pure stages.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa yongs su spyod bar byed pa'i chos bstan pas gnas pa thams cad yongs su sbyong ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa yongs su spyod bar byed pa'i chos bstan pas gnas pa thams cad yongs su sbyong ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the purification of all the stages by means of the teaching that is practiced in the pleasurable state of great joy, he says:

original: chos bcu po gang dag bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: chos bcu po gang dag bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The ten dharmas that have been taught, etc.

original: bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni sa yongs su sbyong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni sa yongs su sbyong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: These ten should be known as the purifications of the stages.

original: de dag gi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to them, he says:

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen pos spong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen pos spong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúantidote to the adverse factors‚Äù means that they are abandoned by means of the antidote to the adverse factors.

original: de dag ni bsdus nas rnam par gzhag pa dang go rims bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni bsdus nas rnam par gzhag pa dang go rims bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate their arrangement and order, he says:

original: sems bskyed pa mi rtsom zhing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa mi rtsom zhing zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not initiate the generation of mind‚Äù means that one does not initiate the generation of mind.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúone does not initiate‚Äù is explained as the lack of faith that is adverse to the clear understanding.

original: mi rtsom pa nyid ni mngon par yid ches pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mi rtsom pa nyid ni mngon par yid ches pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa zhes bstan to //

analyzed: sems mi bskyed pa nyid ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone does not generate mind‚Äù is the lack of faith that is adverse to the aspect of clear understanding.üîΩThus, the lack of faith and the lack of clear understanding are adverse to the accomplishment of the goal.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúone does not initiate the generation of mind‚Äù is explained as the lack of faith that is adverse to the aspect of clear understanding.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúone does not generate mind‚Äù is the lack of faith that is adverse to the aspect of clear understanding.üîΩThus, the lack of faith and the lack of clear understanding are adverse to the accomplishment of the goal.

original: de ltar na dad pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa med pa ni de'i don du sgrub par mi byed de zhes bya ba nas dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na dad pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa med pa ni de'i don du sgrub par mi byed de zhes bya ba nas dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone does not initiate the generation of mind‚Äù is explained as the lack of faith that is adverse to the aspect of clear understanding.
