analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba ni gnod sems dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone does not generate mind‚Äù is the lack of faith that is adverse to the aspect of clear understanding.üîΩThus, the lack of faith and the lack of clear understanding are adverse to the accomplishment of the goal.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúone does not initiate the generation of mind‚Äù is explained as the lack of faith that is adverse to the aspect of clear understanding.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúone does not generate mind‚Äù is the lack of faith that is adverse to the aspect of clear understanding.üîΩThus, the lack of faith and the lack of clear understanding are adverse to the accomplishment of the goal.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúone does not initiate the generation of mind‚Äù is explained as the lack of faith that is adverse to the aspect of clear understanding.

original: snying rje'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: snying rje'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone does not generate mind‚Äù is the lack of faith that is adverse to the aspect of clear understanding.üîΩThus, the lack of faith and the lack of clear understanding are adverse to the accomplishment

original: gnod sems mang du bskyed pa ni byams pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gnod sems mang du bskyed pa ni byams pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The many occasions of malice are the opposite of loving kindness.

original: bdag la chags pa dang / longs spyod la chags pa ni sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang / longs spyod la chags pa ni sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The attachment to self and the attachment to possessions are the opposite of generosity.

original: sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa dang / log par bsgrub pa la skyo ba mang ba ni mi skyo ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so//
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa dang / log par bsgrub pa la skyo ba mang ba ni mi skyo ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so//
translated: The many occasions of weariness with the harm done to sentient beings and with the difficulties of practice are the opposite of non-weariness.

original: @309b bdag dang gzhan gyi don la bstan bcos shes pa med pa ni rmongs pa mang ba ste /
analyzed: @309b bdag dang gzhan gyi don la bstan bcos shes pa med pa ni rmongs pa mang ba ste /
translated: The lack of knowledge of the treatises concerning the aims of self and others is the opposite of great learning.

original: bstan bcos shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /
translated: The opposite of knowledge of the treatises isüîΩthe lack of knowledge of the treatises concerning the aims of self and others.

original: mi des pa la sogs pa la sogs pa ni 'jig rten shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: mi des pa la sogs pa la sogs pa ni 'jig rten shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The lack of knowledge of the world is the opposite of knowledge of the world.

original: gzhan dag la gcig tu sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la gcig tu sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of the production of suffering for others.

original: bya ba ngan pa la chags pa ni bag med pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ngan pa la chags pa ni bag med pa'o //
translated: The attachment to evil actions is heedlessness.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyor ba mi byed pa ni le lo'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyor ba mi byed pa ni le lo'o //
translated: Laziness is the total non-engagement in any wholesome action.

original: de dag gnyis ka yang sdig pa dang rjes su mthun zhing dge ba dang rjes su mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de dag gnyis ka yang sdig pa dang rjes su mthun zhing dge ba dang rjes su mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Both of these are adverse to shame and abashment, because they are in conformity with evil and not in conformity with virtue.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhis nye ba ni bdag nyid brtan par 'dzin par mi nus pas brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhis nye ba ni bdag nyid brtan par 'dzin par mi nus pas brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The proximity of the four kinds of suffering is adverse to the power of steadfastness, because one is unable to hold oneself together.

original: ston pa la mos pa med cing mi dad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: ston pa la mos pa med cing mi dad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Lack of faith and devotion to the teacher is adverse to worship of the Tathagata.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la dad pa dang ldan na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub par byed do zhes bya bas dad pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la dad pa dang ldan na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub par byed do zhes bya bas dad pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the aspiration for faith is stated: One who has faith and devotion to the aims of self and other accomplishes unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje bar byed do zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje bar byed do zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the aspiration for compassion is stated: One who has compassion for suffering beings...

original: sems can yongs su bskyab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byams pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su bskyab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byams pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The line I will protect all sentient beings shows the purity of his intention of love.

original: de ltar na bsam pa rnam par dag pa gsum bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na bsam pa rnam par dag pa gsum bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown the three kinds of purity of intention,

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sbyor ba yongs su dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sbyor ba yongs su dag pa bstan to //
translated: the remaining verses show the purity of his application.

original: go rims bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: go rims bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the order,

original: byang chub la mngon par 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩdad pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi don la snying rje skye'o //
analyzed: byang chub la mngon par 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / dad pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi don la snying rje skye'o //
translated: he says, He who is intent on enlightenment, etc.üîΩOne who has faith generates compassion for the welfare of others.

original: snying rje dang ldan pas gzhan la byams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pas gzhan la byams par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has compassion loves others.

original: snying rje dang byams pa dang ldan pa'i bsam pas ni thams cad gtong ngo //
analyzed: snying rje dang byams pa dang ldan pa'i bsam pas ni thams cad gtong ngo //
translated: One who has the intention of compassion and love gives everything.

original: thams cad gtong bas ni de sems can gyi don la skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad gtong bas ni de sems can gyi don la skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who gives everything is not discouraged about the welfare of sentient beings.

original: skyo ba med pa ni bstan bcos kyi mthar thug par 'gyur bas bstan bcos shes pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skyo ba med pa ni bstan bcos kyi mthar thug par 'gyur bas bstan bcos shes pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: One who is not discouraged knows the treatise well, because he reaches the end of the treatise.

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'jig rten yang shes par 'gyur bas 'jig rten shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'jig rten yang shes par 'gyur bas 'jig rten shes pa bstan to //
translated: and then, following that, he will understand the world. Thus, he demonstrates knowledge of the world.

original: de ltar bstan bcos shes pa dang 'jig rten shes pa ni bdag dang gzhan la ltos nas kun la nyon mongs pa la spyod pa la ngo tsha shes par 'gyur bas ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //üîΩde dag @310a * //
analyzed: de ltar bstan bcos shes pa dang 'jig rten shes pa ni bdag dang gzhan la ltos nas kun la nyon mongs pa la spyod pa la ngo tsha shes par 'gyur bas ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro // de dag @310a * //
translated: Thus, one who has knowledge of the treatises and knowledge of the world becomes endowed with a sense of shame and with a sense of integrity, because he is ashamed of engaging in the mental afflictions in relation to himself and others.

original: dang yang dag par ldan pas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dang yang dag par ldan pas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Endowed with these, he does not come under the power of the mental afflictions.

original: brten pa'i stobs bskyed pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brten pa'i stobs bskyed pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he attains the power of steadfastness.üîΩThus, one who is endowed with right practice increases his wholesome actions.

original: de ltar de yang dag pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes byas pas shes pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa gnyis kyis mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur mang du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di'i go rims yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de yang dag pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes byas pas shes pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa gnyis kyis mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur mang du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di'i go rims yin no //
translated: In this way, the two types of worship and service are made in relation to knowledge. This is the sequence here.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las sa'i le'u ste gsum pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las sa'i le'u ste gsum pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the third chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Stages of the Bodhisattva‚Äôs Practice,‚Äù from The Treatise on the Pith Instructions on the Perfection of Wisdom, Called The Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / de ltar sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / de ltar sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the application of the bodhisattva‚Äôs conduct that is based on the levels,

original: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said ‚Äúin brief‚Äù and so forth.

original: rang gi don rtogs pa'i sbyor ba ni rang gi don rtogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: rang gi don rtogs pa'i sbyor ba ni rang gi don rtogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni gnyis pa'o /
translated: The application of realizing one‚Äôs own goal is the second, from the perspective of realizing one‚Äôs own goal.

original: gzhan gyi don la bya ba la nus pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la bya ba la nus pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The application of working for the sake of others is the third, from the perspective of working for the sake of others.

original: phyi ma gnyis so //
analyzed: phyi ma gnyis so //
translated: The latter two are the application of the bodhisattva‚Äôs conduct.

original: yang na bya ba rnam pa bzhi yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i phyir spyod pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang na bya ba rnam pa bzhi yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i phyir spyod pa bzhi'o //
translated: Or else, the conduct is fourfold because it accomplishes four kinds of activities.

original: bya ba rnam pa bzhi ni tshogs nye bar bsags pa dang / de kho na'i don mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba rnam pa bzhi ni tshogs nye bar bsags pa dang / de kho na'i don mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The four kinds of activities are gathering the accumulations, realizing the meaning of suchness, perfecting power, and accomplishing others‚Äô welfare.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba bzhi po 'di'i phyir spyod pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba bzhi po 'di'i phyir spyod pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four practices of the bodhisattvas are for the sake of these four activities.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par rtogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par rtogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa zhes bstan to //
translated: The practice of the perfections is taught as the practice of the perfections.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The perfections are to be understood in two ways:

original: dngos po nyid kyis rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyis rnam pa drug go //
translated: by their nature, they are six;

original: rab tu dbye ba nyid kyis ni bcu'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba nyid kyis ni bcu'o //
translated: by their differentiation, they are ten.

original: thabs la mkhas pa nyid thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa nyid thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Skill in means is the perfection of means.

original: de la sngar bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sngar bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:üîΩThe first is the perfection of giving.

original: smon lam lnga po nyid smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smon lam lnga po nyid smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The five kinds of vows are the perfection of vows.üîΩIn order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: smon lam rnam pa lnga ni zhes bya ba la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: smon lam rnam pa lnga ni zhes bya ba la sogs ba'o //
translated: The five kinds of vows are the perfection of vows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po yang dag par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba sngar stobs kyi rigs kyi le'ur bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag rnam par dag pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po yang dag par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba sngar stobs kyi rigs kyi le'ur bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag rnam par dag pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The ten powers of a Tathagata are the perfection of power, which is the purification of the application to the realization of the ten powers, as previously indicated in the chapter on the family of power.

original: chos thams cad rnam par 'jog pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par 'jog pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The establishment of all dharmas is the perfection of knowledge.

original: mngon @310b par rtogs pa rnam par 'jog pa ni /
analyzed: mngon @310b par rtogs pa rnam par 'jog pa ni /
translated: The establishment of realization is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩAnother enumeration: the four perfections of giving, morality, patience, and vigor are the perfection of giving, because they are included in the perfection of giving.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //üîΩrnam grangs gzhan yang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni shes rab nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ye shes tshad med pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o // rnam grangs gzhan yang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni shes rab nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ye shes tshad med pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom.

original: bzhi ni rab de ltar gyi cho 'di la don gyi rnam pa thams cad yong su gcod pa la mkhas pa nye bar gzung nas so //
analyzed: bzhi ni rab de ltar gyi cho 'di la don gyi rnam pa thams cad yong su gcod pa la mkhas pa nye bar gzung nas so //
translated: The perfection of skillful means is the immeasurable knowledge of the means of accomplishing the aims of all beings.üîΩThe perfection of vow is the vow for the accomplishment of the aims of all beings.üîΩThe perfection of power is the power to accomplish the aims of all beings.üîΩThe perfection of knowledge is the knowledge of the accomplishment of the aims of all beings.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni gong nas gong du khyad par 'gro ba don du gnyer ba ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni gong nas gong du khyad par 'gro ba don du gnyer ba ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of vows is the aspiration for the future, which is ever more exalted.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlhag par mos pa'i stobs la brten nas /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // lhag par mos pa'i stobs la brten nas /
translated: Because it is the cause for the realization of superior knowledge.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'phrogs par mi nus pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'phrogs par mi nus pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of power is the invincibility of the bodhisattva in every respect, based on the power of superior aspiration.

original: shes bya ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su spyod pa ni nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su spyod pa ni nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the thorough knowledge of the knowable just as it is, because it has the nature of certainty.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of the practice of the factors of enlightenment is the thorough knowledge of the practice of the factors of enlightenment just as it is.

original: yongs su tshol ba dang bcas pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba dang bcas pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge that is associated with the search.

original: gang yongs su smin par bya ba dang // gang gis yongs su smin par byed pa dang / ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang yongs su smin par bya ba dang // gang gis yongs su smin par byed pa dang / ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: What is to be matured, by what it is matured, and how it is matured.

original: gsum po de dag ni yongs su smin pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum po de dag ni yongs su smin pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: These three are taught as being the maturation.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dpag tu med pa tshad med pa dag mdor bsdus nas rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas spyod pa rnam par gzhag pa byas so zhes yongs su gsal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dpag tu med pa tshad med pa dag mdor bsdus nas rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas spyod pa rnam par gzhag pa byas so zhes yongs su gsal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The conduct is presented in terms of the bodhisattva's immeasurable and limitless conduct being summarized.

original: spyod pa 'di bzhis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa'i nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: spyod pa 'di bzhis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // pha rol tu phyin pa'i nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni ;
translated: The conduct is presented by these four and so on.üîΩThe etymology of perfection is taught.

original: rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i don gyis na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i don gyis na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of perfection is going to the end of excellence.

original: rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba dang dus kyi rab kyi mthar 'gro ba ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba dang dus kyi rab kyi mthar 'gro ba ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: Going to the end of excellence and going to the end of time are said to be going to the end of excellence.

original: yun ring po bskal ba grangs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring po bskal ba grangs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For a long time, for countless eons and so on.

original: ngo bor rab kyi mthar thug pa ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: ngo bor rab kyi mthar thug pa ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The highest of the natures is also mentioned:

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúnaturally pure,‚Äù etc.

original: 'bras bu rab kyi mthar gyur pa ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu rab kyi mthar gyur pa ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The highest of the fruits is also mentioned:

original: byang chub mchog gi 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub mchog gi 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe fruit of supreme enlightenment,‚Äù etc.

original: ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la kun du spyod pa de ltar de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyang bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bya @311a * //
analyzed: ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la kun du spyod pa de ltar de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyang bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bya @311a * //
translated: Just as the practice of the resistances is taught, so is the practice of the remedies.

original: bar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyang rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: bar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyang rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The resistances and their remedies are also presented

original: bslab pa gsum po bzhin no //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum po bzhin no //
translated: like the three trainings.

original: 'byung ba nyid kyis ni gang dag rim gyis 'byung ba de dag ni de bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid kyis ni gang dag rim gyis 'byung ba de dag ni de bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
translated: Those that arise in sequence are taught in sequence,

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa bzhin no //
translated: like the meditations and formless [absorptions].

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'bras bu mchog tu zhugs pa de yang rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'bras bu mchog tu zhugs pa de yang rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The result of karmic maturation should be understood in the same way as the supreme result.

original: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bzhin no //
translated: It is like the four bases of beneficence.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni longs spyod la gcig tu zhen pas dang po nyid du longs spyod la ser sna kun du spyod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni longs spyod la gcig tu zhen pas dang po nyid du longs spyod la ser sna kun du spyod do //
translated: In the desire realm, one first practices stinginess with regard to possessions because of attachment to possessions.

original: longs spyod la chags pa'i rgyus lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod par byed do //
analyzed: longs spyod la chags pa'i rgyus lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod par byed do //
translated: Due to attachment to possessions, one engages in misconduct of body, speech, and mind.

original: de'i bar du gcod pa'i dgra la gnod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bar du gcod pa'i dgra la gnod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to that, one injures enemies who are obstacles.

original: gsum po de dag dang ldan pa'i rgyus dge ba'i phyogs la mi spro ba las le lo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum po de dag dang ldan pa'i rgyus dge ba'i phyogs la mi spro ba las le lo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to possessing those three, laziness arises from lack of enthusiasm for virtue.

original: de dang ldan pas yul la rnam par g-yeng bas g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas yul la rnam par g-yeng bas g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to that, one is distracted by objects and becomes agitated.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang ldan pas rmongs shing dman par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang ldan pas rmongs shing dman par 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to agitation, one becomes confused and inferior.

original: des na chos drug po 'di dag ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du gcod pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: des na chos drug po 'di dag ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du gcod pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: Therefore, these six dharmas are the obstacles to perfect enlightenment,

original: de 'thob par byed pa'i chos bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mi mthun par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'thob par byed pa'i chos bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mi mthun par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are adverse to the dharmas of the equipment of merit and knowledge which bring about its attainment.

original: de ltar na mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rim gyis gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rim pa gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rim gyis gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rim pa gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the order of the adverse side is established by the order of the counteragent side.üîΩThe non-establishment of the order of the other four perfections is taught to be included in these two.

original: de las gzhan pa'i lhag ma bzhi'i go rims rnam par ma bzhag pa ni 'di dag nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i lhag ma bzhi'i go rims rnam par ma bzhag pa ni 'di dag nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: de ma yin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other perfections are included in the perfection of giving and the perfection of wisdom.

original: longs spyod gtong ba sngon du 'gro ba las sngom pa yang dag par len par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: longs spyod gtong ba sngon du 'gro ba las sngom pa yang dag par len par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: The perfection of morality is included in the perfection of giving, because one who has given up possessions takes up the restraint of morality.

original: longs spyod la mi lta na khyim gyi 'dod pa rnams btang nas tshul khrims yang dag par len to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod la mi lta na khyim gyi 'dod pa rnams btang nas tshul khrims yang dag par len to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one does not look to enjoyments, then, having given up the desires of the household life, one takes up morality.

original: tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba ni gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa bzod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba ni gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa bzod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras pa /
translated: If one guards morality, then one will be patient with the harm done by others.üîΩIt is said:

original: tshul khrims la gus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one has respect for morality, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar na yang dag par blangs pa rjes su bsrung bas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i phyogs la sems spro ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag par blangs pa rjes su bsrung bas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i phyogs la sems spro ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, by guarding the precepts one has taken, one will have a delight in the virtuous side, which is endowed with pure morality.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: But one will not have it in the side opposed to that.üîΩIt is said:

original: mi 'byung @311b ba dang rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: mi 'byung @311b ba dang rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not arise, and is not continuous, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni bag yod pas mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni bag yod pas mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, one who has begun striving will reach the end through heedfulness.

original: sems rtse gcig pas bde ba la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pas bde ba la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: And one will touch bliss through one-pointedness of mind.

original: de ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni shes bya ji lta ba bzhin shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni shes bya ji lta ba bzhin shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras pa /
translated: Thus, when the mind is concentrated, knowledge of things as they are comes to be.

original: de de ltar sems mnyam par gzhag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de de ltar sems mnyam par gzhag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When he is thus concentrated, etc.

original: de ltar rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de shes rab kyis rab tu shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de shes rab kyis rab tu shes pa yin te /
translated: That which has the characteristic of such knowledge is fully known by wisdom.

original: gang gis zag pa med pa blta bar bya ba mthong ste /
analyzed: gang gis zag pa med pa blta bar bya ba mthong ste /
translated: By it, one sees the uncontaminated reality.

original: ji ltar gzhan dag nas de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ngo zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag nas de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ngo zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúOne knows and sees thus, etc.‚Äù

original: mdor bsdu na sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, the results of generosity, etc., are twofold:

original: longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa dang / lus phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa dang / lus phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: one obtains abundant wealth and one obtains an excellent body.

original: de dag gi rgyu ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dag go rims bzhin no /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dag go rims bzhin no /
translated: Their causes are generosity and morality, respectively.

original: yang tshul khrims ni de las gzhan pa'i dge ba dag dang lhan cig phun sum tshogs pa lnga dang ldan pa'i lus mngon par 'grub par byed do zhes bya bar smras pa /üîΩde ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang tshul khrims ni de las gzhan pa'i dge ba dag dang lhan cig phun sum tshogs pa lnga dang ldan pa'i lus mngon par 'grub par byed do zhes bya bar smras pa / de ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Again, morality is said to be the cause of the attainment of a body endowed with five perfections in common with other virtues.

original: tshe la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i bde 'gro'i lus kyi dngos po rab tu 'thob pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang po ste /
analyzed: tshe la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i bde 'gro'i lus kyi dngos po rab tu 'thob pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang po ste /
translated: The attainment of a body in a happy migratory state, which is superior in terms of life, etc., is the first perfection.

original: de'i rgyu ni tshul khrims so /üîΩde dag gi lus de lta bu yang dag dge ba'i phyogs la yang dag par sbyor ba na sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i phyir skyo ba bzod pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la brnags nus pas gnod pa byed pa bzod pa dang /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni tshul khrims so / de dag gi lus de lta bu yang dag dge ba'i phyogs la yang dag par sbyor ba na sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i phyir skyo ba bzod pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la brnags nus pas gnod pa byed pa bzod pa dang /
translated: Morality is its cause.

original: gzhan la gnod pa byed pa la mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa byed pa la mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When they have such a body, they are not discouraged because they willingly accept suffering when they are correctly engaged in the side of virtue; they are patient with those who harm them because they are able to endure the harm done by others; and they are patient with regard to suffering because they are not averse to the suffering of others.

original: gnod pa mi byed pa ste phun sum tshogs pa 'di dag ni bzod pa rnam pa gsum gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa mi byed pa ste phun sum tshogs pa 'di dag ni bzod pa rnam pa gsum gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: These are the four perfections of the cause of the three kinds of patience.

original: 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second.

original: bdag gi lus de lta bu dang ldan pas brtsams pa thams cad la 'bad pa brtan pa'i go cha gyon par 'gyur ba 'di ni gsum pa'o /
analyzed: bdag gi lus de lta bu dang ldan pas brtsams pa thams cad la 'bad pa brtan pa'i go cha gyon par 'gyur ba 'di ni gsum pa'o /
translated: Having such a body, he is armored with firm effort in all undertakings. This is the third.

original: yang de ni tshe rabs gzhan dag tu brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yang de ni tshe rabs gzhan dag tu brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, in other lives, he is born from the cause of the arising of effort.

original: de ltar brtson 'grus brtan po brtsams pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus brtan po brtsams pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus, he is endowed with the arising of firm effort.

original: dge ba'i phyogs dang yang dag par ldan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun du spyod pa dman par gyur pas nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid kyi phyir de'i gnyen po bsgoms pa la sems las su rung bas des na mngon par shes pa myur @312a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs dang yang dag par ldan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun du spyod pa dman par gyur pas nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid kyi phyir de'i gnyen po bsgoms pa la sems las su rung bas des na mngon par shes pa myur @312a * //
translated: Since he is endowed with the side of virtue, and since he is of little defilement due to the decrease of the practice of the side of demerit which is adverse to that, his mind is fit for the cultivation of the antidote. Therefore, he has swift superknowledge.

original: bar 'gyur ba 'di ni bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: bar 'gyur ba 'di ni bzhi pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth.

original: de yang bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, it arises from the cause of meditative concentration and meditative absorption.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa chung bar gyur pas don mang po la 'jug par nus ba ni blo rgya che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa chung bar gyur pas don mang po la 'jug par nus ba ni blo rgya che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because of the smallness of the afflictions, one is able to engage in many things, and this is called ‚Äúvast intellect.‚Äù

original: don zab mo la 'jug par nus pa ni mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don zab mo la 'jug par nus pa ni mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ability to engage in profound meaning is called ‚Äúwisdom.‚Äù

original: dan la blo myur du 'jug par 'gyur ba ni mdzangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dan la blo myur du 'jug par 'gyur ba ni mdzangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ability to quickly engage in the meaning is called ‚Äúcleverness.‚Äù

original: 'di dag skye ba gzhan du goms par bya ba'i shes rab kyi rgyu las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag skye ba gzhan du goms par bya ba'i shes rab kyi rgyu las byung ba yin te /
translated: These arise from the cause of wisdom that is cultivated in other lives.

original: 'di ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu'i go rims kyis pha rol tu phyin pa'i rim pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu'i go rims kyis pha rol tu phyin pa'i rim pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the order of the perfections is in accordance with the order of the results.

original: bslab pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir smras pa /üîΩde la pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir smras pa / de la pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is said that they are included in the three trainings.üîΩTherein, the four perfections beginning with giving are the accumulation of the training in superior morality.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i tshogs su gyur pa ni sbyin pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i tshogs su gyur pa ni sbyin pa yin te /
translated: Giving is the accumulation of the training in superior morality.

original: longs spyod la ltos pa med na tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: longs spyod la ltos pa med na tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do zhes bstan pas so //
translated: Since it is taught that one undertakes morality when one is not concerned with wealth,

original: tshul khrims nyid ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyid ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: morality is the essence.

original: bzod pa ni 'khor yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa ni 'khor yin no //
translated: Patience is the retinue.

original: tshul khrims kun nas bsrung ba'i don du gzhan gnod par byed pa la bzod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kun nas bsrung ba'i don du gzhan gnod par byed pa la bzod do //
translated: One is patient with harm done by others for the sake of protecting morality.

original: kun nas bsrung ba ni brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: kun nas bsrung ba ni brtson 'grus te /
translated: Protection is effort,

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mi dge ba skyes pa ste skyes pa rnams spong ba dang / mi skye bar byed pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mi dge ba skyes pa ste skyes pa rnams spong ba dang / mi skye bar byed pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with the activity of abandoning the nonvirtue that has arisen and of preventing its arising that is incompatible with it.

original: de ltar na tshogs dang bcas pa nas bsrung ba dang bcas pa'i bar gyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshogs dang bcas pa nas bsrung ba dang bcas pa'i bar gyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the perfection of morality, together with its collection and its protection, teaches the training in superior morality.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The perfection of meditative absorption is the essence of the training in superior mind.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the training in wisdom.

original: bslab pa ni gsum mo zhes bya ba'i nges pas bslab ba'i lam 'di las lhag par ma bstan to //
analyzed: bslab pa ni gsum mo zhes bya ba'i nges pas bslab ba'i lam 'di las lhag par ma bstan to //
translated: The training is threefold, and no higher training is taught beyond this path of training.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Thus, with respect to the training of the bodhisattvas,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa drug rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa drug rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the six perfections are established.

original: bya ba'i gtso bo bzhi yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: bya ba'i gtso bo bzhi yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: Four practices are taught for the sake of accomplishing the four principal activities.

original: spyod pa mang du yod pas bden pa yang der 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa mang du yod pas bden pa yang der 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there are many practices, the truths are included in them.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mdor bsdu na bzhi po 'di dag yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bzhi po 'di dag yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In brief, there are these four.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las spyod pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las spyod pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so //
translated: This concludes the commentary on the fourth chapter on practice in the Bodhisattva Section of the Yogacarabhumi.

original: gnas pa @312b rnam par gzhag pa las bcu gsum pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa @312b rnam par gzhag pa las bcu gsum pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ste /
translated: The thirteenth is the tathagata's stage, which is the stage of the buddhas.

analyzed: rten dang brten par gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nyid gnas pa zhes bya ste /

original: de dag la gnas shing de dag gis gnas par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: de dag la gnas shing de dag gis gnas par rig par bya'o /
translated: It should be understood that the buddhas abide in them and that they abide in them.

original: sa rnam par gzhag pa la ni mthar thug pa'i sa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: sa rnam par gzhag pa la ni mthar thug pa'i sa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The stage of the buddhas is called the ultimate stage.

original: de nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te yongs su rdzogs shing yongs su dag pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te yongs su rdzogs shing yongs su dag pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the stage of the buddhas because the buddhas are distinguished by the perfection and purification of those dharmas.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nyid sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa dang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nyid sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa dang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ste /

original: chos de dag la ma gtogs pa gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos de dag la ma gtogs pa gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from those dharmas, there is no stage that can be distinguished.

original: 'di dag ni rten dang brtan pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rten dang brtan pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: These are the stages that are distinguished as the support and the supported.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes brjod do //
translated: They are called the Buddha‚Äôs qualities because they are not common to others.

translated: The feet are well placed because they are even.üîΩThe feet are even because they are well placed.üîΩThe feet are well placed because they are even

original: 'dod chags spyod pa la sogs pa rkang pa 'dor ba las bzlog pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs bskyod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa la sogs pa rkang pa 'dor ba las bzlog pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs bskyod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He has the gait of a lion, because he walks with a gait that is the opposite of that of one who practices desire, etc.

original: zhabs kyi mthil nyid na mtshan ma'i khyad par mnga' ba ni mtshan gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil nyid na mtshan ma'i khyad par mnga' ba ni mtshan gnyis pa ste /
translated: He has the mark of two marks on the soles of his feet.
