analyzed: rtsibs stong dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gsum rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: He has the three marks of a thousand-spoked wheel, etc., in every way complete.

original: sor mor gtogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sor mor gtogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third mark is the shape of his fingers.

original: zhabs su gtogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: zhabs su gtogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth mark is the shape of his feet.üîΩHe has the mark of soft hands and feet, the mark of webbed fingers and toes, the mark of prominent heels, and the mark of regular feet and legs, without gaps.

original: phyag dang zhabs 'jam pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa dang / sor mo rnams kyi bar dra bas 'brel pa dang / zhabs kyi gong rgyas pa dang / byin pa gnyis rim gyis phra ba'i khyad par dang / sku ma lus pa sra zhing brtan pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs 'jam pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa dang / sor mo rnams kyi bar dra bas 'brel pa dang / zhabs kyi gong rgyas pa dang / byin pa gnyis rim gyis phra ba'i khyad par dang / sku ma lus pa sra zhing brtan pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa dang /
translated: He has the mark of a body that is firm and solid all over.

original: sku drang por bzhugs pa dang / glang po cang shes kyi ltar gsang ba sbubs su nub pa ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: sku drang por bzhugs pa dang / glang po cang shes kyi ltar gsang ba sbubs su nub pa ni dgu pa'o //
translated: His body is straight, and like a well-trained elephant, his secret parts are retracted, the ninth.

original: shing nya gro dha ltar chu @313a * //
analyzed: shing nya gro dha ltar chu @313a * //
translated: Like a nyagrodha tree, his body is

original: zheng gab pa ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: zheng gab pa ni bcu pa'o //
translated: broad and deep, the tenth.

original: 'od 'dom gang ba dang sku'i spu re re nas skyes shing ma reg pa la 'jam pa ste /
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang ba dang sku'i spu re re nas skyes shing ma reg pa la 'jam pa ste /
translated: His light extends a fathom, and each hair on his body grows separately and is soft.

original: des na mdog dang dbyibs smras pa /
analyzed: des na mdog dang dbyibs smras pa /
translated: Thus, his color and shape are described.

original: mthon mthing la lcang lor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mthon mthing la lcang lor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: His hair curls to the right, and so on.

original: 'khyil par gyur na yang mdzes shing bkra shis par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khyil par gyur na yang mdzes shing bkra shis par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that even when it is coiled, it is beautiful and auspicious,

original: g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said to coil to the right.

original: sku'i pags pa'i mdog dang srab pa'i khyad par dang / pags pa reg pa'i khyad par gyis rdul dang dri ma mi 'chags par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sku'i pags pa'i mdog dang srab pa'i khyad par dang / pags pa reg pa'i khyad par gyis rdul dang dri ma mi 'chags par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The difference in the color and thinness of his skin, and the difference in the feel of his skin, show that dust and dirt do not stick to him.

original: bdun mtho ba ni gnas bdun du sha bsags pas mtho bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bdun mtho ba ni gnas bdun du sha bsags pas mtho bar gyur pa ste /
translated: He has seven convex surfaces, because his flesh is piled up in seven places.

original: zhabs gong rgyas par sngar bstan pa ni rgyas pa tsam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhabs gong rgyas par sngar bstan pa ni rgyas pa tsam bstan pa'o //
translated: The broad heels that were mentioned above are just an indication of his broadness.

original: 'dir ni shin tu shas rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni shin tu shas rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, however, it is taught in great detail.

original: seng ge bzhin du ro stod rim gyis stod 'phel che ba dang yangs pas de rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: seng ge bzhin du ro stod rim gyis stod 'phel che ba dang yangs pas de rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The lion-like upper torso is established by the gradual increase and expansion of the upper body.

original: sku'i dbus nas stod kyi cha'i dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i dbus nas stod kyi cha'i dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has the special shape of the upper part of the body from the middle.üîΩIt has shoulders that are piled up like a heap of flesh, and when standing, the body is straight and unmoving.

original: dpung mgo la sha bsags pa lta bu dang ldan pa dang ; bzhugs pa na sku drang zhing mi g-yo ba dang / tshems kyi grangs dang tshad yongs su rdzogs pa nyid dang / de dag nyid la bar mtshams med pa nyid dang / de dag nyid kyi kha dog gi khyad bar nyid do //
analyzed: dpung mgo la sha bsags pa lta bu dang ldan pa dang ; bzhugs pa na sku drang zhing mi g-yo ba dang / tshems kyi grangs dang tshad yongs su rdzogs pa nyid dang / de dag nyid la bar mtshams med pa nyid dang / de dag nyid kyi kha dog gi khyad bar nyid do //
translated: The number and size of the teeth are complete, they are without gaps, and their color is special.üîΩThe shape of the cheeks is like a lion, the tongue is long, broad, and thin.

original: 'gram pa'i dbyibs seng ge'i 'dra ba nyid dang / ljags ring zhing yangs la srab pa nyid dang / ljags ring zhing yangs pa'i bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gram pa'i dbyibs seng ge'i 'dra ba nyid dang / ljags ring zhing yangs la srab pa nyid dang / ljags ring zhing yangs pa'i bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the function of the long and broad tongue,

original: zhal la sogs pa ljags kyis khebs par mdzad pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhal la sogs pa ljags kyis khebs par mdzad pa nyid do //
translated: the tongue covers the face and so forth.

original: ro bro ba'i khyad par mkhyen pa dang ldan pa dang / dbyangs kyi khyad par yang dpes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ro bro ba'i khyad par mkhyen pa dang ldan pa dang / dbyangs kyi khyad par yang dpes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The special knowledge of tastes, and the special knowledge of sounds are taught by way of examples.

original: gsung yid du 'ong ba dan rnga sgra lta bu dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsung yid du 'ong ba dan rnga sgra lta bu dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: His speech is pleasant, like the sound of a conch or a drum.

original: spyan 'bras bu'i kha dog gi khyad par nyid dang / spyan gyi spu'i khyad par nyid dang / dbu'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i thig le'i khyad par lta bu'i g-yas su 'khyil pa'i spu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya'o /
analyzed: spyan 'bras bu'i kha dog gi khyad par nyid dang / spyan gyi spu'i khyad par nyid dang / dbu'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i thig le'i khyad par lta bu'i g-yas su 'khyil pa'i spu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya'o /
translated: The special knowledge of the eyes is the special color of the pupils of the eyes, the special knowledge of the eyelashes, the special knowledge of the head, and the special knowledge of the clockwise hair-curl, which is like the special knowledge of the co-emergent drop.

original: dpe byad rnams kyi grangs yongs su chad pa dang / ming dang rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dpe byad rnams kyi grangs yongs su chad pa dang / ming dang rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The number, names, and arrangement of the marks are as they are taught.

original: de sde pa gzhan dag ni de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba kho na la mtshan dang dpe byad rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes 'dod pa de dgag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / rim gyis 'thob pas @313b rnam par dag par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de sde pa gzhan dag ni de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba kho na la mtshan dang dpe byad rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes 'dod pa de dgag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / rim gyis 'thob pas @313b rnam par dag par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that the other schools should be refuted, since they assert that the major and minor marks are established only for one who will become a Tathagata, and in order to teach that they are purified by gradual attainment, he says:

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la bzhugs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la bzhugs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe Bodhisattva who is on the pure stage of superior intention, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa'i rgyal po'i bu ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rgyud rgyun mi 'chad par zhugs pas mtshan thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa'i rgyal po'i bu ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rgyud rgyun mi 'chad par zhugs pas mtshan thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Just as the prince born in the lineage of a universal monarch becomes endowed with all the major marks by entering the lineage of the universal monarch,

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa'i rgyal ba'i sras ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi gcod par zhugs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa'i rgyal ba'i sras ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi gcod par zhugs par rig par bya'o //
translated: so the Bodhisattva born in the lineage of the Tathagata should be known as entering the lineage of the Buddha.

original: de'i gong ma'i sa dgu gong ma gong ma'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa rdzogs pa nyid kyis byang chub kyi snying po la zhugs pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'i bar gyis zhes bya ba nas ni mngon par byang chub pa'i
analyzed: de'i gong ma'i sa dgu gong ma gong ma'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa rdzogs pa nyid kyis byang chub kyi snying po la zhugs pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'i bar gyis zhes bya ba nas ni mngon par byang chub pa'i
translated: In order to teach the distinctions of the higher nine stages, it says, ‚Äúup to the stage of entering the essence of enlightenment through the perfection of ever-increasing purity.‚Äù

original: dus su rten yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par dang bsam pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus su rten yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par dang bsam pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the distinction of the transformation of the basis and the distinction of intention at the time of manifest enlightenment, it says,

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo'i sangs rgyas kyi chos chen po lhag ma ma lus pa'i rnam par dag pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon par byang chub pa'i dus nyid na'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo'i sangs rgyas kyi chos chen po lhag ma ma lus pa'i rnam par dag pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon par byang chub pa'i dus nyid na'o //
translated: ‚Äúone attains the perfection of the purity of the remaining great qualities of a buddha, which are the essence of form.‚Äù

original: sa la zhugs pa'i dus nas nye bar bzung nas ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na dman pa yin te byang chub pa'i dus 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa'i dus nas nye bar bzung nas ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na dman pa yin te byang chub pa'i dus 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: From the time of entering the stages, in the state of a bodhisattva, it is inferior, not only at the time of enlightenment.

original: de ltar gnas skabs kyi mtshan rnams 'thob par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnas skabs kyi mtshan rnams 'thob par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the characteristics of the states,üîΩnow, in order to teach the characteristics of the result, it says,

original: yang mtshan bstan pa'i mdo las bstan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang mtshan bstan pa'i mdo las bstan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Also, the S≈´tra Teaching the Characteristics teaches causes and results of the characteristics.

original: bya ba mang pos 'jigs pa'i gdul bya la de dag sgrub par byed pa'i lus la spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang / mtshan rnams sgrub par byed pa'i las gang gis las kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa 'thob pa dang mi 'thob ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba mang pos 'jigs pa'i gdul bya la de dag sgrub par byed pa'i lus la spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang / mtshan rnams sgrub par byed pa'i las gang gis las kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa 'thob pa dang mi 'thob ba bstan pa'o //
translated: For disciples who fear many activities, it generates enthusiasm for the body that accomplishes those activities and it teaches the obtainment and nonobtainment of the results of karma that is the karma that grants the results of the characteristics and that increases the characteristics.

original: rnam par smin pas 'thob pa'i mtshan rnams kyi 'bras bu ster ba'i tshogs ni byang chub dang nye ba dang / brtsams pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pas 'thob pa'i mtshan rnams kyi 'bras bu ster ba'i tshogs ni byang chub dang nye ba dang / brtsams pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The collection that grants the results of the characteristics obtained through karmic maturation is the result of the action of beginning enlightenment and it is the result of the action of approaching enlightenment.

original: 'phel ba ma thob pa ni ring ba ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba ma thob pa ni ring ba ste /
translated: That which is not obtained through increase is distant.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rnam par smin pa ma thob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma thob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The characteristics that are not obtained through karmic maturation.

original: de la dang po zhes bya ba ni sa dang po la'o //
analyzed: de la dang po zhes bya ba ni sa dang po la'o //
translated: Therein, the first is on the first ground.

original: de las gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa'i khyad par du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni de las gong du'o //üîΩso so kun yang tshogs ma lus pa las grub pa yin na yang mtshan rnams las sna tshogs kyis mngon par sgrub par mdo las bstan pas de dag gi rgyu nyid bstan @314a * //
analyzed: de las gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa'i khyad par du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni de las gong du'o // so so kun yang tshogs ma lus pa las grub pa yin na yang mtshan rnams las sna tshogs kyis mngon par sgrub par mdo las bstan pas de dag gi rgyu nyid bstan @314a * //
translated: The phrase from that, higher and higher, increasingly pure means from that, higher and higher.

original: pa ni ; gdul bya bya ba mang pos 'jigs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ni ; gdul bya bya ba mang pos 'jigs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Although all of them are accomplished from the collection of all the perfections, the sutra teaches that they are accomplished by various aspects of the perfections. Therefore, the teaching of their causes is taught by the phrase for the sake of those disciples who are afraid of the many activities.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun du spyod pa la zhugs pa'i gdul bya rnams mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog nas gnyen po'i phyogs la yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun du spyod pa la zhugs pa'i gdul bya rnams mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog nas gnyen po'i phyogs la yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase for the sake of those disciples who are afraid of the many activities is taught in order to show that those disciples who engage in the practice of the opposing factors of those perfections are turned away from the opposing factors and are properly established in the antidote.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo brtul zhugs dang rnam pa bzhi la legs par rab tu gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo brtul zhugs dang rnam pa bzhi la legs par rab tu gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase because they are well-established in the four types of austerity that are the essence of the perfections of generosity, morality, and patience is taught in order to show the causes of the four types of austerity.

original: legs par rab tu gnas pa'i rkang pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbla ma'i bsnyen bkur gyi bya ba dang / sems can gyi gnod pa bya ba bsrung ba'i phyir rkang bas 'gro ba dang / 'ongs pa'i bya ba mang du byas pas zhabs mdzes pa nyid 'thob po zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: legs par rab tu gnas pa'i rkang pa yin pa'i phyir ro // bla ma'i bsnyen bkur gyi bya ba dang / sems can gyi gnod pa bya ba bsrung ba'i phyir rkang bas 'gro ba dang / 'ongs pa'i bya ba mang du byas pas zhabs mdzes pa nyid 'thob po zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: because it is the basis of well-established feet.üîΩHe has beautiful feet because he has performed many actions of going and coming, in order to serve his gurus and to protect sentient beings from harm.

original: phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa brnyes so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa brnyes so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: He has hands and feet with webbed fingers and toes, because he has given away much wealth and has protected sentient beings from many kinds of harm.

original: mtshan sgrub par byed pa'i las 'di dag ni ji ltar rigs par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi nang du 'dus par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan sgrub par byed pa'i las 'di dag ni ji ltar rigs par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi nang du 'dus par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: These actions that produce the marks should be connected with the perfections, as appropriate.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las kyi tshogs pa'i tshe na 'khor lo'i rjes su 'byung ba'i 'khor lo 'thob po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las kyi tshogs pa'i tshe na 'khor lo'i rjes su 'byung ba'i 'khor lo 'thob po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When one performs the collection of actions that produce the marks without transgression, one obtains the wheel-marks.

original: sems can rnams la srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa spangs pa dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / lag pas byas pa'i sdig pa ma byas pa dang / des byas pa'i dge ba byas pas phyag sor ring zhing legs pa brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams la srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa spangs pa dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / lag pas byas pa'i sdig pa ma byas pa dang / des byas pa'i dge ba byas pas phyag sor ring zhing legs pa brnyes pa yin no //
translated: He obtains long and beautiful fingers and toes by abandoning harm to sentient beings, such as killing, by serving the guru, by not committing sins with his hands, and by performing virtue with his hands.

original: sor mo smos pa ni brkyang bskum la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: sor mo smos pa ni brkyang bskum la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The mention of fingers and toes illustrates the activities of extending and retracting.

original: gzhan dag gi yid mgu bar bya ba la ma bsgyings pa dang gzhan dag la gnod pa spangs pa dang / dga' ba'i longs spyod nyams par ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi yid mgu bar bya ba la ma bsgyings pa dang gzhan dag la gnod pa spangs pa dang / dga' ba'i longs spyod nyams par ma byas pa ste /
translated: He obtains fingers and toes that are neither too long nor too short by not being arrogant in pleasing others, by abandoning harm to others, and by not diminishing the enjoyment of others.

original: ma byin par len pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / thung bar byed pa'i las zhal gyis mi bzhes pas na mi thung ba'i sor mo dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / thung bar byed pa'i las zhal gyis mi bzhes pas na mi thung ba'i sor mo dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that he obtains fingers and toes that are neither too long nor too short because he abandons stealing and does not accept the work of shortening.

original: nga rgyal nges par bcom pa zhes bya ba 'dis kyang yan lag ring ba 'thob pa'i las bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal nges par bcom pa zhes bya ba 'dis kyang yan lag ring ba 'thob pa'i las bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the action that produces the long fingers.

original: las gsum po gang dag gi skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gsum de dag 'grub par bstan pa las de dag kun gyi zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa 'grub pa bstan te /
analyzed: las gsum po gang dag gi skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gsum de dag 'grub par bstan pa las de dag kun gyi zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa 'grub pa bstan te /
translated: Among the three actions that produce the thirty-two marks of a great person, the action that produces the broad heels is shown.

original: ji ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po'i rten 'byung ba chen po yang las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa bzhin no //üîΩbla ma'i zhing dang sems can rnams bsdu @314b ba'i las byas pas phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bar 'brel pa brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po'i rten 'byung ba chen po yang las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa bzhin no // bla ma'i zhing dang sems can rnams bsdu @314b ba'i las byas pas phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bar 'brel pa brnyes pa yin no //
translated: The broad heels are like the great elements that are the support of the aggregates, which are the result of the evolution of karma.üîΩThe action of serving the guru and gathering sentient beings produces the webbed hands and feet.

original: de dag nyid la reg bya'i khyad par gyis bsnyen ba kur byas pa ni yan lag gi reg bya khyad par can brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid la reg bya'i khyad par gyis bsnyen ba kur byas pa ni yan lag gi reg bya khyad par can brnyes pa yin no //
translated: The action of serving the guru and sentient beings with special tactile objects produces the soft and youthful hands and feet.

original: dge ba spel ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas ni zhabs ma yangs pa 'thob po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba spel ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas ni zhabs ma yangs pa 'thob po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: He obtains feet with heels that are prominent because he is endowed with the application of increasing virtue.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams gong nas gong du spel ba ni zhabs 'bar 'bur med ba brnyes so zhes bstan ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams gong nas gong du spel ba ni zhabs 'bar 'bur med ba brnyes so zhes bstan ba yin no //
translated: He obtains feet without depressions because he increases virtuous dharmas higher and higher.

original: bdag nyid kyang bstan pa'i chos la legs par zhugs shing gzhan la yang myur du ston te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang bstan pa'i chos la legs par zhugs shing gzhan la yang myur du ston te /
translated: He himself properly engages in the Dharma of the teachings and he quickly teaches others.

original: gzhan gyi bya ba dag kyang myur du sgrub par byed pa 'gro zhing 'ong ba la nus pa dang ldan pa'i yan lag 'thob par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bya ba dag kyang myur du sgrub par byed pa 'gro zhing 'ong ba la nus pa dang ldan pa'i yan lag 'thob par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: He obtains limbs that are capable of going and coming because he quickly accomplishes the activities of others.

original: mdo sde la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos rnams rim gyis bstan pas slob ma gcig nas gcig tu chos kyi tshul yang dag par ston pas ni /
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos rnams rim gyis bstan pas slob ma gcig nas gcig tu chos kyi tshul yang dag par ston pas ni /
translated: He obtains a body that is not bent over because he teaches the Dharma of the teachings, such as the sutras, in sequence, and he properly teaches the way of the Dharma from one disciple to another.

original: sku rim gyis drang zhing che bar bstan pa'i phyir yid dang lus la sogs pa la yon po med pas sku ma btud pa brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: sku rim gyis drang zhing che bar bstan pa'i phyir yid dang lus la sogs pa la yon po med pas sku ma btud pa brnyes pa yin no //
translated: He obtains a body that is not stooped because his body, mind and so forth are not crooked.

original: legs par brtan pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid la gcig tu zhen bar byed pa brtan pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: legs par brtan pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid la gcig tu zhen bar byed pa brtan pa'i phyir te //
translated: The phrase firmly stable means that he is firmly stable because he is intent on that alone.

original: des na lus la sogs pa'i las rnams de las bzlog par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na lus la sogs pa'i las rnams de las bzlog par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, his bodily and other actions are not turned away from that.

original: de bzhin du dam pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i sdig ba'i las rnams spangs pa dang / nad kyis mnar zhing nyam thag pa bslang bas kyang sku ma btud pa brnyes par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du dam pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i sdig ba'i las rnams spangs pa dang / nad kyis mnar zhing nyam thag pa bslang bas kyang sku ma btud pa brnyes par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, in order to demonstrate that he attained the unbowed body by abandoning sinful actions that are the basis of the holy life and by raising up the sick and afflicted,

original: nad pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nad pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: the root text says, ‚Äúto the sick,‚Äù and so on.

original: yang zas la gcig tu zhen pa med pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la mi zhen par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: yang zas la gcig tu zhen pa med pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la mi zhen par sbyor ba ste /
translated: Moreover, he is not intent on food and is not attached to sensual pleasures.

original: de lta bu'i las rnam pa bzhis sku ma btud pa brnyes par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i las rnam pa bzhis sku ma btud pa brnyes par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he demonstrates the unbowed body by means of these four kinds of actions.

original: gzhan dag gis bskrad cing gnas med pa'i gnod pas nyen pa rnams la chos dang mthun par bsdus pa dang ngo tsha dang ldan zhing khrel yod pa rnams la yod pa rnams la gsang bdag ba pa byin pas ni mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa 'thobüîΩpar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bskrad cing gnas med pa'i gnod pas nyen pa rnams la chos dang mthun par bsdus pa dang ngo tsha dang ldan zhing khrel yod pa rnams la yod pa rnams la gsang bdag ba pa byin pas ni mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa 'thob par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those who are tormented by harm from others and have no place to stay are gathered in accordance with the Dharma and those who are ashamed and have a sense of propriety are given clothing.

original: gnas med pa bsdus pas ni spu bas thob pa yin la /
analyzed: gnas med pa bsdus pas ni spu bas thob pa yin la /
translated: By gathering those without a place to stay, one obtains body hair.

original: cig shos kyis ni sba ba nub pa yin no //
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni sba ba nub pa yin no //
translated: By the other, one obtains the male organ that is retracted into a sheath.

original: lus la sogs pa bsdoms pas mi mnyam pa'i las la mi 'jug pa dang / yongs su 'dzin ba'i kha zas la tshod zin pas mi mthun pa'i kha zas la mi 'jug pa dang / nad pa rnams la sman byin pa dang / khams ma snyoms pa rnams kyi mthun par byas nas gsum @315a * //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa bsdoms pas mi mnyam pa'i las la mi 'jug pa dang / yongs su 'dzin ba'i kha zas la tshod zin pas mi mthun pa'i kha zas la mi 'jug pa dang / nad pa rnams la sman byin pa dang / khams ma snyoms pa rnams kyi mthun par byas nas gsum @315a * //
translated: By gathering body, etc., one does not engage in uneven action, by gathering food, one does not engage in uneven food, and by giving medicine to the sick and making the elements of those with unbalanced elements harmonious, one engages in these three.

original: po 'di dag la 'jug pa bstan pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: po 'di dag la 'jug pa bstan pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid ces bya ba la /
translated: The teaching on engaging in body, speech and mind is as follows.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa la mi 'jug pas sku chu zheng gab pa brnyes pa yin te kun gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i sku zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa la mi 'jug pas sku chu zheng gab pa brnyes pa yin te kun gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i sku zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since he does not engage in such disharmony, he has attained the body that is covered with a cloak, which is to say, a body that is desired by all.

original: las gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: las gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the question, ‚ÄúBy what actions?‚Äù and so on,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gong nas gong du 'phel bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gong nas gong du 'phel bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the increase of the roots of virtue,

original: sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: the Buddha teaches that the body hairs point upward.

original: bdag nyid kyis dge ba spyad pa la mkhas pa'i phyir gcig pu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis dge ba spyad pa la mkhas pa'i phyir gcig pu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is skilled in practicing virtue himself, he is said to dwell alone.

original: mkhas pa dang rgan pa la brten pas na bshes gnyen gcig la brten pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa dang rgan pa la brten pas na bshes gnyen gcig la brten pa'o //
translated: Because he relies on a wise and elderly person, he relies on a single friend.

original: dpyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir cha phra pa'i don la sems pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir cha phra pa'i don la sems pa'o //
translated: Because he is discerning, he reflects on subtle meanings.

original: mkhas pa dang rgan pa la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mkhas pa dang rgan pa la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he relies on a wise and elderly person,

original: bla ma rnams kyi gnas kyi byi dor byas pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma rnams kyi gnas kyi byi dor byas pa'o //
translated: he cleans the dwelling of his superiors.

original: chu la sogs pa nas rtsva dang la ma la sogs pa bsal ba dang / lam gyi bsrel dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i mchod rten la sogs pa'i gnas phyag bdag byed pas ni spu re re nas skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa nas rtsva dang la ma la sogs pa bsal ba dang / lam gyi bsrel dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i mchod rten la sogs pa'i gnas phyag bdag byed pas ni spu re re nas skyes pa yin no //
translated: The hair of his head and body grows separately from the roots, because he has removed grass, reeds, etc. from water, etc. and has swept the grounds of natural shrines, etc.

original: gnas pa gcig pas cha pha ba'i don la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa gcig pas cha pha ba'i don la 'jug pa'o //
translated: He has the hair of his head and body curling to the right, because he has approached the meaning of the Dharma with a one-pointed mind.

original: glo bur gyi dri ma bsal bas na spu re re nas ma 'dzings pa brnyes pa ste /üîΩkha dog dang dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i spu nyid do //
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma bsal bas na spu re re nas ma 'dzings pa brnyes pa ste / kha dog dang dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i spu nyid do //
translated: He has hair and head that are not matted, because he has removed the impurities of others.üîΩHe has hair of the head and body that is soft and pliant, because he has given soft and pure foods.

original: dga' bar byed pa'i zhes bya bas ni kha dog phun sum tshogs pa sbyin par ston to //üîΩkhro ba med bas zhes bya ba ni khros pa kha dog ngan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa'i zhes bya bas ni kha dog phun sum tshogs pa sbyin par ston to // khro ba med bas zhes bya ba ni khros pa kha dog ngan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has hair of the head and body that is glossy, because he has given pleasing things.üîΩHe has hair of the head and body that is blue-black, because he has been free from anger, since anger is the cause of a bad complexion.

original: de med pas kha dog phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: de med pas kha dog phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: The absence of anger is the cause for obtaining a good complexion.

original: 'od 'dom gang ba yang kha dog gi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang ba yang kha dog gi khyad par yin no //
translated: The halo extending an arm‚Äôs length is a special quality of his complexion.

original: las gang gis zhes bya ba ni cha phra ba la 'jug pas pags pa srab pa brnyes ba yin no //
analyzed: las gang gis zhes bya ba ni cha phra ba la 'jug pas pags pa srab pa brnyes ba yin no //
translated: The phrase by what karma refers to the attainment of smooth skin because of engaging in subtle karma.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bsal bas ni pags pa 'jam pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bsal bas ni pags pa 'jam pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
translated: The phrase having removed the stains of the mental afflictions refers to the attainment of soft skin.

original: zas dang skom mang bo zhes bya ba ni rab tu mang ba'o //
analyzed: zas dang skom mang bo zhes bya ba ni rab tu mang ba'o //
translated: The phrase abundant food and drink refers to a great deal of food and drink.

original: gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni phul du byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase excellent refers to the best.

original: phal po che zhes bya ba ni sna chogs pas so //
analyzed: phal po che zhes bya ba ni sna chogs pas so //
translated: The phrase a variety refers to a diversity.

original: gsar pa zhes bya ba ni rnying pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsar pa zhes bya ba ni rnying pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase fresh refers to what is not old.

original: de lta bu'i dngos bo bzang po byin pas na sku'i bdun mtho ba thob pa yin //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos bo bzang po byin pas na sku'i bdun mtho ba thob pa yin //
translated: The phrase having given such excellent things refers to the attainment of seven prominent body parts.

original: gtso bor gnas pa dang zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs brgyud la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: gtso bor gnas pa dang zhes bya ba ni rang gi rigs brgyud la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: The phrase having lived in a prominent place refers to one's own family lineage and so on.

original: nga rgyal mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lus dang ngag dang yid nga rgyal med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lus dang ngag dang yid nga rgyal med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase without pride and so on indicates that one's body, speech, and mind are free of pride.

original: sems can rnams la gnod pa @315b bzlog pa las ni bzlog ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod pa @315b bzlog pa las ni bzlog ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: From the prevention of harm to sentient beings, from the prevention and so on.

original: don thams cad bya ba'i phyir shin tu pha rol gnon pa'i ngang tshul can gyi sku brnyes par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: don thams cad bya ba'i phyir shin tu pha rol gnon pa'i ngang tshul can gyi sku brnyes par bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is taught that he attained a body that is the nature of the utmost heroism for the sake of all purposes.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: seng ge bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: seng ge bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Like a lion, and so on.

original: las de kho nas ni zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: las de kho nas ni zhes bya ba ni //
translated: By that very action, by that very action

original: seng ge bzhin du pha rol gnon pa'i ngang tshul can dang sku ro stod seng ge dang 'dra ba rab tu brnyes pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: seng ge bzhin du pha rol gnon pa'i ngang tshul can dang sku ro stod seng ge dang 'dra ba rab tu brnyes pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that he attained the nature of the utmost heroism like a lion and a body with a lion-like upper part.

original: las gang gi zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la bya ba ma yin pa'i las ma byas pa dang / bya bar 'od pa'i las byas pas sku che zhing drang ba brnyes so //
analyzed: las gang gi zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la bya ba ma yin pa'i las ma byas pa dang / bya bar 'od pa'i las byas pas sku che zhing drang ba brnyes so //
translated: By the action of not doing what should not be done for others and doing what should be done, he attained a large and straight body.

original: dbye ba'i tshig ma smras pa dang / bye bya rnams bsdums byas pas ni tshems tshang ba dang / bar med pa dang / mnyam pa brnyes te /
analyzed: dbye ba'i tshig ma smras pa dang / bye bya rnams bsdums byas pas ni tshems tshang ba dang / bar med pa dang / mnyam pa brnyes te /
translated: By not speaking divisive words and reconciling those who are divided, he attained complete teeth, without gaps, and even teeth.

original: sems can gzhan bsdums byas pas so //
analyzed: sems can gzhan bsdums byas pas so //
translated: because he has reconciled other sentient beings.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa smos pa ni mtshan rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams dang 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa smos pa ni mtshan rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams dang 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the desire realm‚Äù is mentioned because the marks are related to sentient beings who live in the desire realm.

original: byams pa bsgoms pas ni bsam pa rnam bar dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: byams pa bsgoms pas ni bsam pa rnam bar dag pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe has cultivated loving-kindness‚Äù shows the purity of his attitude.

original: chos kyi don sems pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi don sems pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe has reflected on the meaning of the Dharma‚Äù

original: shes pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dag pa'o //
translated: shows the purity of his knowledge.

original: de ltar gnyis ka rnam par dag pas ni tshems shin tu dkar ba nyid brnyes so //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis ka rnam par dag pas ni tshems shin tu dkar ba nyid brnyes so //
translated: Thus, by the purity of both, he has attained the mark of having extremely white teeth.

original: snod dang dngos po phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni 'gram pa seng ge lta bu'i brnyes te /
analyzed: snod dang dngos po phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni 'gram pa seng ge lta bu'i brnyes te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe has given gifts of vessels and objects in abundance‚Äù shows the mark of having jaws like the king of beasts.

original: de yang chen po nyid dang 'dod pa nyid de chen po nyid ni yid du 'ong ba dang tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang chen po nyid dang 'dod pa nyid de chen po nyid ni yid du 'ong ba dang tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: This mark is both large and desirable.

original: bdag gi bu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems can la snying brtse ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi bu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems can la snying brtse ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe has treated all sentient beings as if they were his own children‚Äù shows his compassion for sentient beings.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni rab tu dang ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni rab tu dang ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe has been faithful‚Äù shows his attitude of devotion.

original: snying brtse ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa can no //
analyzed: snying brtse ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa can no //
translated: The phrase endowed with compassion means that he has the intention to benefit and bring happiness.

original: sman byin pa dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su gzung ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: sman byin pa dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su gzung ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase having given medicine means that he has the intention to care for others.

original: de lta bus ni ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa brnyes pa yin gte /üîΩro bro ba'i mchog 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de lta bus ni ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa brnyes pa yin gte / ro bro ba'i mchog 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas /
translated: By means of these, he has attained the quality of having the supreme taste.

original: gang ci yang rung pa ljags la bdar ba de thams cad ro'i mchog dang gya nom par 'gyur ro //üîΩlhag pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi bcud byin pa dang / chos kyi bdud kyi ro myongs pa dang / ro nyams pa bcos ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ma rtogs pa'i don gsal por bstan pas ro bro ba'i mchog brnyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang ci yang rung pa ljags la bdar ba de thams cad ro'i mchog dang gya nom par 'gyur ro // lhag pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi bcud byin pa dang / chos kyi bdud kyi ro myongs pa dang / ro nyams pa bcos ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ma rtogs pa'i don gsal por bstan pas ro bro ba'i mchog brnyes pa nyid do //
translated: Because he possesses the characteristic of having the supreme taste, whatever he places on his tongue becomes the most excellent and sublime taste.üîΩIn order to teach the special cause of this, the root text says, having given the essence of the Dharma, having experienced the taste of the Dharma, and having cured those with impaired taste. He has attained the quality of having the supreme taste because he has clarified the meaning of what is not understood.

original: bslab pa'i gnas mthon bo rnams la bdag nyid kyang yang dag par @316a * //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gnas mthon bo rnams la bdag nyid kyang yang dag par @316a * //
translated: He has attained the quality of having a broad tongue because he has the ability to teach the Dharma in a way that is appropriate for those to be trained.

original: gnas pas dbu'i gtsug tor 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gnas pas dbu'i gtsug tor 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: By abiding in the Dharma, he attained the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a on the head.

original: gzhan dag kyang de la 'god par byed pa'i chos ston par byed pa la gzhol bas ni ljags ring zhing srab pa brnyes so //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de la 'god par byed pa'i chos ston par byed pa la gzhol bas ni ljags ring zhing srab pa brnyes so //
translated: By being intent on teaching the Dharma that establishes others in that, he attained the long and broad tongue.

original: rnam pa thams cad du brdzun du smra ba spangs pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa brnyes so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du brdzun du smra ba spangs pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa brnyes so //
translated: By abandoning lying in all its forms, he attained the BrahmƒÅ voice.

original: 'jam zhing byams pa'i yid kyis sems can rnams la blta bas na sbyan mthon mthing dang / ba'i rdzi ma lta bu brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam zhing byams pa'i yid kyis sems can rnams la blta bas na sbyan mthon mthing dang / ba'i rdzi ma lta bu brnyes pa yin no //
translated: By looking at sentient beings with a gentle and loving mind, he attained eyes like an utpala flower and eyelashes like a cow.üîΩBy praising the true qualities of others and teaching them to be endowed with good qualities, he attained the white hair between the eyebrows.

original: gzhan dag gi yang dag pa'i yon tan gyi bsngags pa brjod cing yon tan dang ldan par bstan pas ni dkar zhing ring pa'i mdzod spu brnyes par bstan pa'i phyir yon tan can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshan rnams ni bdag gi lus phunüîΩsum tshogs pas bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi yang dag pa'i yon tan gyi bsngags pa brjod cing yon tan dang ldan par bstan pas ni dkar zhing ring pa'i mdzod spu brnyes par bstan pa'i phyir yon tan can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshan rnams ni bdag gi lus phunüîΩsum tshogs pas bsdus pa yin la /
translated: The qualities are included in the perfection of the body.

original: lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / mtshan thams cad kyang bye brag med par tshul khrims kyi rgyus thob pa yin no zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / mtshan thams cad kyang bye brag med par tshul khrims kyi rgyus thob pa yin no zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: The perfection of the body and all the marks are obtained through the cause of morality.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams kyis ji skad bstan pa'i las rnams byas pas mtshan thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams kyis ji skad bstan pa'i las rnams byas pas mtshan thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Those who possess morality obtain all the marks by performing the actions taught above.

original: 'dir rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the logic here, he says, ‚ÄúWhy is this?

original: 'ga' zhig spyi gtsug ba ltar mi mthong ba'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ma bstan to snyam du the tshom za ba bzlog pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig spyi gtsug ba ltar mi mthong ba'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ma bstan to snyam du the tshom za ba bzlog pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to dispel the doubt of someone who thinks that the mark of a great being is not visible on the crown of the head, he says,

original: gnyis ka yang gcig yin par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di la don gyi khyad par ni med kyi /
analyzed: gnyis ka yang gcig yin par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di la don gyi khyad par ni med kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúBoth should be understood as one.‚Äù There is no difference in meaning here.

original: 'on kyang rnam grangs kyi khyad par yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam grangs kyi khyad par yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: However, it is taught that there is a difference in terms of enumeration.

original: de ltar mtshan rnams sgrub par byed pa'i las rnam par gzhag ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan rnams sgrub par byed pa'i las rnam par gzhag ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the actions that establish the characteristics have been presented.

original: las de dag nyid kyi rnam pa dang rten dang ; sbyor ba'i bye drag bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //
analyzed: las de dag nyid kyi rnam pa dang rten dang ; sbyor ba'i bye drag bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //
translated: In order to demonstrate the types, bases, and applications of those actions, he says:

original: mdor bsdu na las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa bzhi ni nges par byas pas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa bzhi ni nges par byas pas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In brief, the culmination of action is well done, etc. The four types are: done with certainty, etc.,

original: kha na ma tho ba med par byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med par byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to: done without offense.

original: rnam pa 'di dag gis ni ji skad bstan pa'i las rnams rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag gis ni ji skad bstan pa'i las rnams rig par bya'o //
translated: By these types, the actions as they have been taught should be understood.

original: las de dag gi rten ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: las de dag gi rten ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: The bases of those actions are householders and monastics.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: phyogs gnyis su gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis su gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are of two types.

original: legs par byas pa nyid ni gnod pa med pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: legs par byas pa nyid ni gnod pa med pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Well done is that which is done with an application that is not harmful.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: rnam pa bzhis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

translated: ‚ÄúBecause it leads to the experience of suffering.‚Äù

original: 'og gi phyogs su 'gro bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir dang / nyam nga ba'i sdug bsngal myong bas smre sngags 'don pa'i sgra chen po 'don pas na log par ltung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'og gi phyogs su 'gro bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir dang / nyam nga ba'i sdug bsngal myong bas smre sngags 'don pa'i sgra chen po 'don pas na log par ltung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúfall‚Äù because it is distinguished by leading downward and because it is a great cry of lamentation due to the experience of terrible suffering.

original: sgyid lug pa che thang du skyes pas na dmyal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgyid lug pa che thang du skyes pas na dmyal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúhell‚Äù because it is a place of great dejection.

original: de ltar na las byas pa gang gis skye ba dang / gang nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal @326a * //
analyzed: de ltar na las byas pa gang gis skye ba dang / gang nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal @326a * //
translated: Thus, the action that is done and the place where one is born are suffering.

original: nyid do // sdug bsngal de ma yin pa gzhan yang mngon par 'grub pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyid do // sdug bsngal de ma yin pa gzhan yang mngon par 'grub pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúOther than that suffering, there is the establishment of suffering‚Äù means

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'grub pa'i rgyu'i las byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'grub pa'i rgyu'i las byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that the action that is the cause for the establishment of future suffering is done.

original: de ltar na shin tu dman pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bus rab tu phye ba'i phyir dang / der skyes par gyur pa rnams dmad pa'i las kun du spyod pa'i phyir de dag la brten nas dmyal ba'i ming rnam pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na shin tu dman pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bus rab tu phye ba'i phyir dang / der skyes par gyur pa rnams dmad pa'i las kun du spyod pa'i phyir de dag la brten nas dmyal ba'i ming rnam pa gsum bstan to //
translated: Thus, the names of the hells are taught based on the three types of causes and results that are distinguished by being extremely inferior, and based on the fact that those who are born there engage in contemptible actions.

original: yang na rgyu dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas bstan to //
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas bstan to //
translated: Or else, they are taught from the perspective of the cause, the result of natural outflow, and the result of conscious effort.

original: de las bzlog pa'i las ci rigs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems can 'di dag ni lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i las ci rigs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems can 'di dag ni lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that should be applied as appropriate.

original: kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang lus dang ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang lus dang ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: These sentient beings possess physical virtue means that they possess perfect morality together with its motivation and they possess physical, verbal, and mental virtue.

original: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa ga nyis la sogs pa yang sngar bstan pa las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: lta ba phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa ga nyis la sogs pa yang sngar bstan pa las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The two types of perfect view and so on are the opposite of what was previously explained.

original: rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid kyang khyad par can du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid kyang khyad par can du shes par bya'o //
translated: The cause and the effect should be understood as distinguished.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: legs par spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who has gone to the culmination of the practice of the wholesome, etc.‚Äù

original: snga ma bzhin du gzhan yang gang zag pa rnams zad pas zag pa med pa'i sems rnam par grol ba dang ; shes rab rnam par grol bas tshe 'di nyid la bdag nyid kyis mngon par shes pa mngon sum du byas nas snyoms par zhugs nas gnas so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gzhan yang gang zag pa rnams zad pas zag pa med pa'i sems rnam par grol ba dang ; shes rab rnam par grol bas tshe 'di nyid la bdag nyid kyis mngon par shes pa mngon sum du byas nas snyoms par zhugs nas gnas so //
translated: As before, moreover, the one who has extinguished the defilements, through the mind liberated from the defilements and through the liberation of wisdom, in this very life, having actualized the superknowledges, abides.

original: gzhan dag la yang ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang ston par byed do //
translated: He also teaches others.

original: bdag gi skye ba ni zad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba ni zad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúMy births are destroyed,‚Äù up to ‚ÄúI know the practice that leads to the destruction of suffering.‚Äù

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan ni mi shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan ni mi shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúI do not know any other existence beyond this.‚Äù

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu pa'o //
translated: This is the tenth power of the TathƒÅgata.

original: zag pa thams cad kyi bag la nyal ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni zag pa zad do zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa thams cad kyi bag la nyal ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni zag pa zad do zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the complete abandonment of all defilements and their residues‚Äù explains the meaning of ‚Äúthe defilements are extinguished.‚Äù

original: zag pa med pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase with an uncontaminated mind means

original: sems rnam par grol ba'i don 'dod chags la chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba ni sems rnam par grol ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba'i don 'dod chags la chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba ni sems rnam par grol ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: that the mind is liberated. The meaning of liberated mind is that it is free from attachment to attachment.

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang srid pa'i zag pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang srid pa'i zag pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the contaminants of the realm of desire and the contaminants of the realm of form are abandoned.

original: zag pa mad pa'i shes rab ni shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa mad pa'i shes rab ni shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase with uncontaminated wisdom means that wisdom is liberated.

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa spangs pa'i phyir @326b ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa spangs pa'i phyir @326b ro //
translated: This is because the contaminant of ignorance is abandoned.

original: de gnyis ka'i lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab par rnam par gzhag par bya'o //üîΩmchog nyid kyis ni yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab par rnam par gzhag par bya'o // mchog nyid kyis ni yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase with the liberation of mind and wisdom means that the liberation of mind and the liberation of wisdom are established as the higher training in mind and the higher training in wisdom, respectively.üîΩ The phrase in this very life is stated to show that the Buddha is supreme.

original: srid pa tham de nyid la zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa tham de nyid la zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of this phrase is that the Buddha is liberated in this very life.

original: rang gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase by himself means that the Buddha is liberated by himself.

original: mngon par shes pa drug pas zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa yin no //üîΩyang de ni mthong ba dang sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug pas zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa yin no // yang de ni mthong ba dang sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: By means of the six superknowledges means by means of the superknowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: mthong ba'i lam la yang brten zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la yang brten zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in order to show that it is included in the path that is the antidote to the afflictions to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation, he says, It is also based on the path of seeing, etc.

original: bdag gis thob po snyam du zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid kyis mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba de'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis thob po snyam du zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid kyis mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba de'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: By I have attained, he shows the meaning of I have actualized it by means of my own superknowledge.

original: 'dod na gzhan dag la yang zhes bya bas ni de dag gnyis ka'i don bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod na gzhan dag la yang zhes bya bas ni de dag gnyis ka'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: By if he wishes, he can also make it known to others, he shows the meaning of both.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: tshig rnams kyi dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag gi skye ba ni zad do zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rnams kyi dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag gi skye ba ni zad do zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: As for the classification of the words, etc., the end of my births means entering the eighth stage.

original: bdag gis tshangs par spyod pa ni spyad do zhes bya ba ni lam legs par bsgoms pas yongs su nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis tshangs par spyod pa ni spyad do zhes bya ba ni lam legs par bsgoms pas yongs su nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: The passage, I have practiced pure conduct, refers to the absence of any degeneration from the path that has been well cultivated.

original: bya ba byas so zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pas lam 'bras bu dang bcas par thob pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba byas so zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pas lam 'bras bu dang bcas par thob pa'o //
translated: The passage, I have done what is to be done, refers to the attainment of the path together with its fruit, because all the fetters have been abandoned.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan ni mi shes so zhes bya ba ni srid pa bdun pa la sogs pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan ni mi shes so zhes bya ba ni srid pa bdun pa la sogs pa zad pa'o //
translated: The passage, There is no more existence here and there, refers to the exhaustion of the seven types of existence and so on.

original: de ltar mdo'i don bstan nas yang rnam pa bdun gyis stobs bstan par 'dod nas smras pa ;
analyzed: de ltar mdo'i don bstan nas yang rnam pa bdun gyis stobs bstan par 'dod nas smras pa ;
translated: Having thus explained the meaning of the sutra, he wishes to demonstrate the powers by means of seven aspects, and so he says:

original: rang bzhin dang ni rab dbye dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni stobs kyi rnam pa thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni rab dbye dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni stobs kyi rnam pa thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the teaching is in order to understand all the aspects of the powers.

original: ma 'dres ba ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma 'dres ba ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The passage, unshared, refers to the fact that they are not common to others.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni thun mong ba nyid do //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni thun mong ba nyid do //
translated: The passage, equality, refers to the fact that they are common.

original: las byed pa ni stobs kyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: las byed pa ni stobs kyi bya ba'o //
translated: The passage, function, refers to the activity of the powers.

original: go rims ni mthar gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: go rims ni mthar gyis bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage, order, refers to the sequential teaching.

original: bye brag ni phan tshun gyi byed pa sna chogs pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag ni phan tshun gyi byed pa sna chogs pa'o //
translated: The specific activity is the various activities of the faculties.

original: shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas rang bzhin ni dbang po lnga yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas rang bzhin ni dbang po lnga yin te /
translated: The nature is the five faculties, because they are the nature of wisdom.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon par nus pa'i phyir stobs bcu'i bya ba nyid de /üîΩlhan cig byed pa dang bcas pas don bya ba byed @327a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon par nus pa'i phyir stobs bcu'i bya ba nyid de / lhan cig byed pa dang bcas pas don bya ba byed @327a * //
translated: The activity is the activity of the ten powers, because they are able to overpower the resistances.

original: nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The endowment is the endowment of the ability to perform benefits, because they are accompanied by the cooperative conditions.

original: gtso bo yin ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo las /
analyzed: gtso bo yin ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo las /
translated: The preeminence is that, as a sutra declares,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i tshig gis mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i tshig gis mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin no //
translated: they are called powers because they are the powers of knowledge, as indicated by the words, ‚ÄúOne knows as it is.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The power of the knowledge of bases and nonbases, etc.

original: dngos po tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid do //
translated: The immeasurability is due to the immeasurable things on which they focus.

original: tshad med pa nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: The classification of the immeasurables should be explained.

original: dus gsum kun nas 'jug pa'i phyir dus chad med pa nyid kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum kun nas 'jug pa'i phyir dus chad med pa nyid kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: The classification of the uninterrupted time is because of the engagement in all three times.

original: shes bya'i dngos po gcig gi yang rab tu dbye ba tshad med pa'i phyir shes bya'i rab tu dbye ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi rgyud kyi don la 'jug pa nyid ni rgyud tshad med pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po gcig gi yang rab tu dbye ba tshad med pa'i phyir shes bya'i rab tu dbye ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi rgyud kyi don la 'jug pa nyid ni rgyud tshad med pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: The classification of the knowable is the classification of the objects of knowledge, because of the immeasurability of the classifications of even a single thing that is an object of knowledge. The classification of the immeasurable continua is the engagement in the continua of the realms of sentient beings in all the world systems of the ten directions.

original: de bzhin du stobs thams cad kyang re re zhing tshad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du stobs thams cad kyang re re zhing tshad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, all the powers should be understood as immeasurable, each one.

original: 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i yin gyi nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni ma yin pas des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i yin gyi nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni ma yin pas des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: These are only of the Tathagata and not of the sravakas, etc. Therefore, they are called the powers of the Tathagata.

original: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya zhing des na ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya zhing des na ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called uncommon, and therefore, they are called unshared.

original: mnyam pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs la khyad par med de /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs la khyad par med de /
translated: In order to demonstrate their equality, it says, there is no difference in the powers of all the Tathagatas.

original: sku'i stobs dang ye shes kyi stobs mnyam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sku'i stobs dang ye shes kyi stobs mnyam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The power of the body and the power of intuition are equal.

original: gzhan du na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku mnyam pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku mnyam pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would not attain the equality of the body of all Buddhas.

original: stobs rnams la khyad par med pa bden na yang gnas pa las khyad par yod pa bstan pa'i phyir dus kyi khyad par dang mos pa'i khyad par dang / gdul bya'i khyad par la ltos nas de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' zhig la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs rnams la khyad par med pa bden na yang gnas pa las khyad par yod pa bstan pa'i phyir dus kyi khyad par dang mos pa'i khyad par dang / gdul bya'i khyad par la ltos nas de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' zhig la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there is no difference in power, the difference in duration is taught, because the Tathagata abides for a certain time, in dependence on the difference in aspiration and the difference in disciples.

original: stobs ldan thams cad las rgyal zhing //
analyzed: stobs ldan thams cad las rgyal zhing //
translated: The Lord of the powerful, the conqueror,

original: 'jig rten na ni gang brjod pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni gang brjod pa //
translated: The one who is called in the world

original: rtsod bral khyad par 'phags pa nyid //
analyzed: rtsod bral khyad par 'phags pa nyid //
translated: The one who is free from dispute, the one who is superior,

original: thub pa khyod la rdzogs par mnga' //
analyzed: thub pa khyod la rdzogs par mnga' //
translated: The Sage, you have perfected.

original: zhes bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstod pa yin no //
translated: This is the praise.

original: de lta bu dang yang dag par ldan pa de sems can rnams la 'jigs pa skyed par mdzad dam /
analyzed: de lta bu dang yang dag par ldan pa de sems can rnams la 'jigs pa skyed par mdzad dam /
translated: Does he, who is endowed in this way, generate fear in sentient beings?

original: 'on te phan 'dogs par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: 'on te phan 'dogs par mdzad ce na /
translated: Or does he generate benefit?

original: mdzad pa yang nges par ston par mdzad ni des na bstod pa las /
analyzed: mdzad pa yang nges par ston par mdzad ni des na bstod pa las /
translated: Thus the praise in honor of the Buddha says,üîΩYou are powerful, fearless,üîΩand you have no anxiety.üîΩIt is wonderful that you do not despise others

original: stobs ldan 'jigs mi 'gyur bas khyod //üîΩmi bsnyengs gang lags rigs lags na //üîΩmthu mnga' bzhin du gzhan @327b du yang ;üîΩ/ khyad du mi gsod gang de rmad //üîΩces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: stobs ldan 'jigs mi 'gyur bas khyod // mi bsnyengs gang lags rigs lags na // mthu mnga' bzhin du gzhan @327b du yang ; / khyad du mi gsod gang de rmad // ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: even though you possess power.

original: stobs 'di dag ni re re zhing yang rang gi don bsgrub pa dang / gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas las rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: stobs 'di dag ni re re zhing yang rang gi don bsgrub pa dang / gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas las rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Each of these powers is established in terms of accomplishing one‚Äôs own goal and accomplishing the goals of others.üîΩIn this regard, he possesses the wisdom that is not confused about all objects of knowledge in order to accomplish his own goal.

original: de la rang gi don bsgrub pa'i phyir shes bya thams cad la ma rmongs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rang gi don bsgrub pa'i phyir shes bya thams cad la ma rmongs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And he possesses the wisdom that is not obstructed about all objects of knowledge in order to accomplish the goals of others.

translated: By the power of knowledge of the supreme and not supreme faculties, having known the faculties of sentient beings, he teaches the Dharma in accord with their faculties. These are the two activities.

original: pa mkhyen nas de dag las bzlog par mdzad do //
analyzed: pa mkhyen nas de dag las bzlog par mdzad do //
translated: By the power of knowledge of manifold resolves, having known the inferior resolves of sentient beings, such as their inferior resolve, etc., he causes them to turn away from those.

original: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de dang de mkhyen nas 'jug pa'i sgo de dang de la spyor bar mdzad pas na 'jug par mdzad do zhes bya ba'o //

translated: By the power of knowledge of manifold constituents, having known this and that constituent, he engages them in this and that door of entry.

original: nyan thos rnams la gdams pa'i bya ba ni nyan thos kyis las gsungs pas yang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la gdams pa'i bya ba ni nyan thos kyis las gsungs pas yang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos bdag med par rab tu rtogs par bya ba la sbyar bar bya ba yin pas zhes byas nas de dag la gdams pa'i bya ba ni gzhan yin pas de'i phyir de dag gi khyad par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since bodhisattvas are to be engaged in the realization of the selflessness of dharmas, the function of instruction for them is different. Therefore, in order to demonstrate their distinction,

analyzed: las dang po pa ni ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la 'dris par ma byas pa'o //

original: de nyid bstan pa ni /üîΩlas thog ma pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni / las thog ma pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is taught:üîΩThe beginner is one who has not yet attained the attention of the Great Vehicle.

original: yang na sgom pa yid la byed pa la yang dag par ma zhugs pa ni las thog ma pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sgom pa yid la byed pa la yang dag par ma zhugs pa ni las thog ma pa'o //

original: yang de ni rnam pa gnyis te ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa spang ba'i phyir smras pa /

translated: Moreover, that is twofold: one who has completed the accumulation for samƒÅdhi and one who has not completed the accumulation for samƒÅdhi. In order to abandon those, it is said:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: One who has not completed the accumulation for samƒÅdhi should first complete the accumulation for samƒÅdhi.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /

original: mngon par zhen pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
