original: mngon par zhen pa med pa spang pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa spang pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to abandon attachment, he said:

original: sems gnas par 'dod pa de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems gnas par 'dod pa de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who wishes to stabilize the mind. ‚Äù

original: 'dir yang mtshan ma med pa la sems gnas pa'i sgom pa'i dbang du byas nas gdams ngag gi bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mtshan ma med pa la sems gnas pa'i sgom pa'i dbang du byas nas gdams ngag gi bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the function of instruction is taught from the perspective of the cultivation of stabilizing the mind in the absence of signs.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i sgom pa dang chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i don la zhugs pa na nges par 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i sgom pa dang chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i don la zhugs pa na nges par 'grub pa yin te /
translated: When one cultivates the absence of signs and engages in the meaning of the inexpressibility of all phenomena, one definitely achieves it,

original: don de la ming dang rgyu mtshan la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rab tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don de la ming dang rgyu mtshan la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rab tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one abandons conceptualization in terms of names, causal signs, and so on with regard to that meaning.

original: de dag spangs pas yang ming dang rgyu mtshan dag glo bur bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag spangs pas yang ming dang rgyu mtshan dag glo bur bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By abandoning those, one also sees names and causal signs as adventitious.

original: ming de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ming de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those names are also of two kinds:

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sngon gyi spros pa'i bag chags su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sngon gyi spros pa'i bag chags su gtogs pa ste /
translated: those that belong to the imprints of conceptual proliferation that have been transmitted from one to another since beginningless time,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: and those that are newly created by oneself.

original: gzugs dang sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / ma dang pha la sogs pas dang po sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / ma dang pha la sogs pas dang po sgro btags pa'o //
translated: The first is the superimposition of form, sound, and so on, and mother, father, and so on.

original: 'dir ni dang por de la 'jug par 'gyur ro //üîΩrab tu dben pa'i gnas ma la du //
analyzed: 'dir ni dang por de la 'jug par 'gyur ro // rab tu dben pa'i gnas ma la du //
translated: Here, one first engages in that.üîΩIn a secluded place, it is said.

original: zhes smos pa ni dben pa'i gnas su don @328b yid la bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes smos pa ni dben pa'i gnas su don @328b yid la bya ba'o //
translated: In a secluded place, one should attend to the meaning.

original: 'du 'dzi gnas pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi gnas pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Not in a place of distraction, it is said.üîΩ Therefore, it is said, The body should be secluded, and alone, and so on.

original: de'i phyir lus dben par bya'o zhes bya bar smras pa dang / gcig pu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la ming ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dben par bya'o zhes bya bar smras pa dang / gcig pu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la ming ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of names:

original: khyim pa'i phyogs dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi'o //
translated: those belonging to the householder's side and those belonging to the renunciant's side.

original: khyim pa'i phyogs kyir gtogs pa smras pa /
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs kyir gtogs pa smras pa /
translated: Those belonging to the householder's side are stated:

original: pha ma gnyis sam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha ma gnyis sam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Both parents, and so on.

original: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyis smras pa /
translated: Those belonging to the renunciant's side are stated:

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gnyis kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gnyis kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Both preceptor and teacher, and so on.

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir ming de nyid nang du yid la byos la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩsems can gyi rdzas kyi rtsa pa ni skye mched drug yin la de dag so so la de'i mtshan nyid med pas de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir ming de nyid nang du yid la byos la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / sems can gyi rdzas kyi rtsa pa ni skye mched drug yin la de dag so so la de'i mtshan nyid med pas de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the aspects of mental attention, he says, ‚ÄúYou should attend to that name internally, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag gi skye mched la ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag gi skye mched la ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The substance of sentient beings is the six sense spheres, and since they do not have the characteristics of each of those, he says, ‚Äúnot included in the sense spheres of a self, etc.‚Äù

original: nang ngam zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi skye mched de de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nang ngam zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi skye mched de de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúInternally‚Äù means the sense spheres that have an internal nature; the meaning is that they have that nature.

original: phyir rol na zhes bya ba ni phyi'i skye mched ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyir rol na zhes bya ba ni phyi'i skye mched ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExternally‚Äù means the external sense spheres;

original: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the meaning is that they have that nature.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na yang yod dam zhes bya ba ni de dag gnyis ka las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na yang yod dam zhes bya ba ni de dag gnyis ka las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúBetween the two‚Äù means liberated from both of those; the meaning is that they are liberated from both of those.

original: mi dmigs kyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ming dang bral ba'i phyir dang / ming ni glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs kyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ming dang bral ba'i phyir dang / ming ni glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase not perceived is because all phenomena are free from names and because names are adventitious.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: khyod 'di kho na snyam du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyod 'di kho na snyam du zhes bya ba la /
translated: You think this is so, and so on.

original: de ltar rjes su mi mthun pa'i dmigs pas glo bur ba'i chos rnams la ming mi brten la /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su mi mthun pa'i dmigs pas glo bur ba'i chos rnams la ming mi brten la /
translated: Thus, due to the non-concordant perception, names are not based on adventitious phenomena,

original: ming la yang de dag med de glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming la yang de dag med de glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and they do not exist in names because they are adventitious.

original: 'du shes skyes shing zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa dang mthun pa bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rab tu thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes skyes shing zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa dang mthun pa bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rab tu thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase when perception arises means that it is fully attained through the power of cultivating what is concordant with mental attention.

original: de ltar re zhig rang gi ming glo bur ba'i 'du shes kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rang gi ming glo bur ba'i 'du shes kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Thus, first, having taken one's own name as the basis of adventitious perception, it is said:

original: mig la mig ces bya ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mig la mig ces bya ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The eye is called 'eye,' and so on.

original: gnyis dmigs te zhes bya ba ni ming dang rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: gnyis dmigs te zhes bya ba ni ming dang rgyu mtshan te /
translated: The phrase two are perceived refers to the name and the causal process,

original: mngon par brjod pa dang / mngon par brjod pa'i tshig gi gnas so //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa dang / mngon par brjod pa'i tshig gi gnas so //
translated: which are the expression and the basis of the expression.

original: de yang ming dang ming nyid de /
analyzed: de yang ming dang ming nyid de /
translated: Moreover, name and name-ness

original: de yang brjod bya dang rjod pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de yang brjod bya dang rjod pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: are distinguished as the expressed and the expresser.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bo nyid mig ces brjod na yang rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bo nyid ni mig ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bo nyid mig ces brjod na yang rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bo nyid ni mig ma yin te /
translated: When the nature of the reason is called ‚Äúeye,‚Äù the nature of the reason is not the eye,

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du ming la ma ltos par gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du ming la ma ltos par gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like form, etc., it is not apprehended without depending on the name.

original: @329a * // de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: @329a * // de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mig gi gdags pa med par ni su yang mig gi blo 'jug par mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig gi gdags pa med par ni su yang mig gi blo 'jug par mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout the designation ‚Äòeye,‚Äô the cognition of eye would not occur to anyone.‚Äù

original: gal te yang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la ming ma thos pa'i sngon du yang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo 'jug par 'gyur na ni de bzhin du mig la yang 'jug par 'gyur na de ltar ni 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la ming ma thos pa'i sngon du yang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo 'jug par 'gyur na ni de bzhin du mig la yang 'jug par 'gyur na de ltar ni 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: If the cognition of form, etc., occurred prior to hearing the name, then the cognition of eye would also occur in the same way, but it does not occur in that way.

original: de'i phyir ming dang mig ni shin tu tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ming dang mig ni shin tu tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, name and eye are completely different,

original: ming yang gzhan la mig kyang gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ming yang gzhan la mig kyang gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because the name is one thing and the eye is another.

original: des na glo bur ba'i chos la glo bur ba'i ming gis 'du shes par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na glo bur ba'i chos la glo bur ba'i ming gis 'du shes par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the designation of adventitious phenomena by the name ‚Äúadventitious‚Äù is also adventitious.

original: de de ltar yid la byed pa na mig gi 'du shas la yang snga ma bzhin du glo bur ba yin pa'i 'du shes skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar yid la byed pa na mig gi 'du shas la yang snga ma bzhin du glo bur ba yin pa'i 'du shes skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is thus attentive, the idea that the perception of the eye is adventitious arises in the same way as before.

original: de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi ming thams cad kyi mngon par zhen pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi ming thams cad kyi mngon par zhen pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the attachment to all such names,

analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus par chos rnams de ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: one should understand that all phenomena are like that by means of the path of application.

original: 'du shes 'di lta bus kun du rtog par byed pa'i stobs kyis chos thams cad la spros pa'i 'du shes bsal nas dngos po de nyid la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes 'di lta bus kun du rtog par byed pa'i stobs kyis chos thams cad la spros pa'i 'du shes bsal nas dngos po de nyid la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: By the power of conceiving all phenomena in this way with this kind of perception, having eliminated the perception of conceptual elaboration with regard to all phenomena, one should abide with a non-conceptual mind in that very thing.

original: de lta bur gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni rigs dang rigs rgyud ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni rigs dang rigs rgyud ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: That concentration which is signless is the meaning of family and lineage.

original: de'i rigs su gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la sems rtse gcig pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rigs su gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la sems rtse gcig pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: One attains one-pointedness of mind in that concentration which is of that family.

original: de ltar yid la byed pa de ni mig thams cad la 'jug pa na rjes su 'gro ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir yid la byed pa 'di ma btang zhig ces bya ba'o ;
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa de ni mig thams cad la 'jug pa na rjes su 'gro ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir yid la byed pa 'di ma btang zhig ces bya ba'o ;
translated: In order to show that this attention is engaged in all eyes, it is said: Do not give up this attention.

original: / nyan thos rnams kyis kyang yid la byed pa 'di nyid mang du bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / nyan thos rnams kyis kyang yid la byed pa 'di nyid mang du bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that even the Sravakas should cultivate this attention many times, it is said:

original: mngon par shes pa shin tu myur bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thos nas skrag par 'gyur la goms par byed nus pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa shin tu myur bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thos nas skrag par 'gyur la goms par byed nus pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One attains the superknowledges very quickly. This means: having heard, one becomes frightened, but one is able to cultivate.

original: stobs lhag ma rnams kyi las ni gzhung nyid las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs lhag ma rnams kyi las ni gzhung nyid las rig par bya'o //
translated: The functions of the remaining powers should be understood from the text itself.

original: stobs rnams ni rim gyis thob pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs rnams ni rim gyis thob pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the powers are not attained gradually,

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu cig car brnyes te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu cig car brnyes te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúImmediately upon his full enlightenment, he attained them all at once.‚Äù

original: mngon sum du bya ba dang bya ba'i dbang gis 'di dag gi rim pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba dang bya ba'i dbang gis 'di dag gi rim pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate their sequence in terms of direct realization and activity, it is said:

original: de dag gi rim gyis mngon sum du @329b 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rim gyis mngon sum du @329b 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe directly realized them in sequence.‚Äù

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúImmediately upon his full enlightenment‚Äù means that he is definitely delivered from cyclic existence,

original: 'khor pa las nges par rgal ba'i gnas pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor pa las nges par rgal ba'i gnas pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: and he abides in the state of being definitely delivered from cyclic existence.

original: yun ring por zhugs par gyur pa'i 'khor ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu 'jug par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: yun ring por zhugs par gyur pa'i 'khor ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu 'jug par 'gyur ba la /
translated: The causes and effects of cyclic existence, which have been operating for a long time,üîΩare no longer operative.

original: rnam par gzigs nas gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs mngon sum du mdzad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs nas gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs mngon sum du mdzad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of proper and improper conditions.üîΩHaving seen in this way, he teaches the Dharma to those who are to be guided, using the power of knowledge of the results of actions and their ripening.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of various dhƒÅtus, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of various aspirations.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of various forms of devotion, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of previous lives.

original: de ltar rnam par gzigs nas dus ring por goms par byas pa'i lus tha ma thob pa gang yin pa dang / ris mthun pa'i 'dod pa'i khams la mngon par mthong pa 'dod pa rnams la las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis mi dge ba yongs su spong du gzhug pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzigs nas dus ring por goms par byas pa'i lus tha ma thob pa gang yin pa dang / ris mthun pa'i 'dod pa'i khams la mngon par mthong pa 'dod pa rnams la las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis mi dge ba yongs su spong du gzhug pa dang /
translated: Having seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of the extinction of defilements.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of the absorptions, liberations, concentrations, and attainments, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of superior and common qualities.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of various dhƒÅtus, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of various aspirations.

original: dge ba yang dag par bsgrub pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba yang dag par bsgrub pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Having seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of various forms of devotion, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of previous lives.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of the extinction of defilements.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of the absorptions, liberations, concentrations, and attainments, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of superior and common qualities.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of various dhƒÅtus, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of various aspirations.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere.

original: khams gong ma dag tu skye bar 'dod pa rnams la ni stobs gsum pa mngon sum du byas nas 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag sbyin par mdzad do //
analyzed: khams gong ma dag tu skye bar 'dod pa rnams la ni stobs gsum pa mngon sum du byas nas 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag sbyin par mdzad do //
translated: Having seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of various forms of devotion, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of previous lives.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, and teaches the Dharma using the power of knowledge of the extinction of defilements.üîΩHaving seen, he manifests the power of knowledge of the absorptions, liberations, concentrations, and attainments, and teaches

original: de bzhin du khams gsum gyi sems can rnams la 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas stobs gsum po rnams rim gyis mngon sum du mdzad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum gyi sems can rnams la 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas stobs gsum po rnams rim gyis mngon sum du mdzad par shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be understood that the three powers are manifested in sequence with regard to the sentient beings of the three realms, in terms of mundane excellence.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas mngon sum du bya ba'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas mngon sum du bya ba'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the sequence of manifestation in terms of supramundane excellence, he says:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod pa rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod pa rnams la dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa nyid dang bsam pa dang bag la nyal gyi khyad par la ltos nas de dag gi lam bstan pa'i phyir stobs gsum mngon du byas nas dbang po
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod pa rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod pa rnams la dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa nyid dang bsam pa dang bag la nyal gyi khyad par la ltos nas de dag gi lam bstan pa'i phyir stobs gsum mngon du byas nas dbang po
translated: For those who desire supramundane freedom...

original: la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs par mdzad do //
analyzed: la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs par mdzad do //
translated: For those who desire supramundane freedom, in dependence on the distinctions of faculties, superior and non-superior, intentions, and latent tendencies, in order to teach their path, having manifested the three powers, he sees their faculties and so forth just as they are.

original: kun du gzigs nas spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'jug pa'i sgo thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'dzud par mdzad do //
analyzed: kun du gzigs nas spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'jug pa'i sgo thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'dzud par mdzad do //
translated: Having seen all this, he causes them to enter by the power of knowing the paths that lead everywhere, which is in accord with their conduct.

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas stobs gnyis kyis dbu ma'i lam ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas stobs gnyis kyis dbu ma'i lam ston par mdzad do //
translated: Having thus attained the samadhi that is the door of entry, he teaches the middle way by means of the two powers.

original: yang des na mtha' gnyis ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin la /
analyzed: yang des na mtha' gnyis ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin la /
translated: Moreover, the two extremes have the view of the transitory collection as their root.

original: dbu ma'i lam ni bdag med pa mthong ba'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam ni bdag med pa mthong ba'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The middle way has the vision of selflessness as its root.

original: @330a * // bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i dngos pos ni rtag pa dang chad par ltung bar byed do //
analyzed: @330a * // bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i dngos pos ni rtag pa dang chad par ltung bar byed do //
translated: The view of self and entities connected with self causes one to fall into eternalism and nihilism.

original: dbu ma'i lam ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar zhugs pa yin no shes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar zhugs pa yin no shes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The middle way is the entry to the abandonment of all afflictions because it is the antidote to the three realms.üîΩIn order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: de ltar yang dag par brtson zhing rgyu dge ba'i rtsa bas nye bar bstan pa de ni brgya la ma spangs na yang nyon mongs pas kun du spyod par me 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par brtson zhing rgyu dge ba'i rtsa bas nye bar bstan pa de ni brgya la ma spangs na yang nyon mongs pas kun du spyod par me 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, through the correct effort and the roots of virtue that are taught, even if one does not abandon the hundred, one will not be overwhelmed by the afflictions.

original: de'i phyir kha cig ni ma byas bzhin du byas par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha cig ni ma byas bzhin du byas par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed do //
translated: Therefore, some make the false claim that they have done what they have not done.

original: de dag gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal stobs bcu pas spong bar mdzad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal stobs bcu pas spong bar mdzad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one with the ten powers eliminates their false claims.

original: go rims kyi rnam grangs gcig yin no //
analyzed: go rims kyi rnam grangs gcig yin no //
translated: This is one way of enumerating the sequence.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With regard to the dharmas of dependent origination,

original: gang rab tu ma rtogs pas dus ring por 'khor bar gnas par gyur pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di yin zhes bya bas kyang chos gnas pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: gang rab tu ma rtogs pas dus ring por 'khor bar gnas par gyur pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di yin zhes bya bas kyang chos gnas pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par mdzad do //
translated: he realizes with the knowledge of the way things are that this is dependent origination, due to which one remains in cyclic existence for a long time because of not realizing it.

original: ye shes de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can yongs su shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ye shes de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can yongs su shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes brjod do //
translated: That intuition is the power of knowledge of proper and improper conditions, because it is the aspect of thorough knowledge which has the characteristic of unerring cause and effect.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par gzigs nas khyim pa rnams la stobs gnyis pas las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa la dus gsum du gzigs par mdzad de /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par gzigs nas khyim pa rnams la stobs gnyis pas las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa la dus gsum du gzigs par mdzad de /
translated: Thus, having seen dependent origination, he sees the three times in the correct adoption of the path of action for householders by means of the second power.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems can gyi khams la rnam par gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems can gyi khams la rnam par gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he sees the realm of sentient beings who are filled with the afflictions.

original: stobs gsum pas rab tu byung ba rnam par byang ba yang dag par blang ba la 'ga' zhig rnam par byang ba'i snod du gyur pa yod dam zhes rnam par gzhigs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs gsum pas rab tu byung ba rnam par byang ba yang dag par blang ba la 'ga' zhig rnam par byang ba'i snod du gyur pa yod dam zhes rnam par gzhigs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And he analyzes whether there is anyone who is a vessel of purification in the correct adoption of the purification of those who have gone forth by means of the third power.

original: stobs lhag ma rnams kyi snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: stobs lhag ma rnams kyi snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining powers should be understood in the same way as the first.

original: gzigs nas kyang rnam par byang ba la sbyor bar mdzad de /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang rnam par byang ba la sbyor bar mdzad de /
translated: Having seen, he causes them to be connected with purification.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang rim pa de bzhin no //üîΩchos kyi khams dang zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la 'jug pa'i rgyu yid la byed pas chos de dag nyid la snyad kyi rjes su 'jug pas byed pa po la sogs pa'i sems can gyi khams med na yang rang gis byas pa'i las la nye bar spyod
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang rim pa de bzhin no // chos kyi khams dang zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la 'jug pa'i rgyu yid la byed pas chos de dag nyid la snyad kyi rjes su 'jug pas byed pa po la sogs pa'i sems can gyi khams med na yang rang gis byas pa'i las la nye bar spyod
translated: The rest are in the same order.

original: pa yid la byed pa la rnam par gzigs par mdzad do //üîΩde bzhin du 'dus byas bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas @330b sdug bsngal nyam nga ba thob pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal rnams las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir stobs gsum pas dbang po dang /
analyzed: pa yid la byed pa la rnam par gzigs par mdzad do // de bzhin du 'dus byas bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas @330b sdug bsngal nyam nga ba thob pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal rnams las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir stobs gsum pas dbang po dang /
translated: The element of mental objects is the mental activity that is the cause of engaging mental objects. He sees the mental activity that is the experience of those mental objects themselves, even though there is no element of sentient beings such as an agent, etc.

original: mos pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam nye bar ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: mos pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam nye bar ston par mdzad do //
translated: In the same way, in order to liberate from suffering those who have attained suffering through the misapprehension of the self in the selflessness of the conditioned, by means of the third power, he teaches the path that is in accordance with their faculties and their inclinations.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi go rims ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi go rims ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The order of the rest is the same as before.

original: stobs rnams kyi phan tshun byed brag yod pa dang bye brag med pa bstan pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rab tu mkhyen to
analyzed: stobs rnams kyi phan tshun byed brag yod pa dang bye brag med pa bstan pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rab tu mkhyen to
translated: The difference and non-difference of the powers is shown. By the power of knowledge regarding proper and improper conditions, he knows the desirable and undesirable results of good and bad actions.

original: // las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen ba'i stobs kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: // las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen ba'i stobs kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The power of knowledge regarding one's deeds are one's own is also like that.

original: de ltar na bye brag ci yod ce na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na bye brag ci yod ce na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the difference between them?

original: spyi dang bye brag gi rnam pa ni de dag gi bye brag go //üîΩgzhan yang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nges par yod pa yang rgyu gang gis las byas pa de la 'bras bu smon gyi gzhan la ma yin pa dang ma byas pa dang mi phrad pa'i dbang du byas nas stobs gnyis pa'i bye brag de yin
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag gi rnam pa ni de dag gi bye brag go // gzhan yang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nges par yod pa yang rgyu gang gis las byas pa de la 'bras bu smon gyi gzhan la ma yin pa dang ma byas pa dang mi phrad pa'i dbang du byas nas stobs gnyis pa'i bye brag de yin
translated: The difference between them is the general and specific aspects.

original: par shes par bya'o /
analyzed: par shes par bya'o /
translated: Moreover, that difference between the second and third powers should be understood in terms of the certainty of desirable and undesirable results, the fact that one obtains the result of an action done and not another, and the fact that one does not encounter the result of an action not done.

original: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar ba gang la yang brten nas sems can rnams la gdams par byed pa ni bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar ba gang la yang brten nas sems can rnams la gdams par byed pa ni bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of knowledge of meditations and liberations is the knowledge of how to instruct sentient beings in any meditation or liberation.

original: bsam gtan la brten nas las dang 'bras bu 'brel par shes pa gang yin pa de ni las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas las dang 'bras bu 'brel par shes pa gang yin pa de ni las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of knowledge of one‚Äôs deeds are one‚Äôs own is the knowledge of the connection between actions and their results, based on meditation.

original: bsam gtan gyi dbang gis dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems tsam du thugs su chud pa nyid ni bsam gtan la sogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dbang gis dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems tsam du thugs su chud pa nyid ni bsam gtan la sogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: The power of knowledge of superior and nonsuperior faculties is the knowledge of the mind alone, which is associated with the faculties, by the power of meditation.

original: dbang po'i bye brag mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: dbang po'i bye brag mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: The power of knowledge of superior and nonsuperior faculties is the knowledge of the differences in faculties.

original: dbang po sngon du 'gro ba'i bsam pa'i spyi mkhyen pa ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas so //
analyzed: dbang po sngon du 'gro ba'i bsam pa'i spyi mkhyen pa ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas so //
translated: The power of knowledge of superior and nonsuperior faculties is the knowledge of the general attitude that is preceded by the faculties.

original: khyad par mkhyen pa ni mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: khyad par mkhyen pa ni mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: The knowledge of the special is by the power of knowing the various inclinations.

original: bsam pa rnam pa rnam pa drug bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam pa rnam pa drug bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The intention is taught in six aspects.

original: bsam pa de yang mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsam pa de yang mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore he says: and that intention is, in brief, of two kinds, etc.

original: gnas ma yin pa la lhag par mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa de lta bus nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la lhag par mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa de lta bus nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intention of beings who are devoted to what is not the proper basis is not a going forth, because of that intention.

original: rang gi lam la mos pa'i sems can rnams bsam pa des khams gsum las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba ni nges par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lam la mos pa'i sems can rnams bsam pa des khams gsum las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba ni nges par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //

original: @331a * // de ltar mos pa'i bye brag gis bsam pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: @331a * // de ltar mos pa'i bye brag gis bsam pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, the intention is of two kinds, according to the distinction of devotion.

original: yang bsam pa phyi ma de dus kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang bsam pa phyi ma de dus kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa'i phyir /

original: rnam par dag pa las ring ba dang rnam par dag pa dang nye ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa las ring ba dang rnam par dag pa dang nye ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Far from purity and near to purity.

original: yongs su smin pa'i chung ngu dang / 'bring la gnas pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa dang yongs su smin pa la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i chung ngu dang / 'bring la gnas pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa dang yongs su smin pa la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //

original: smin pa chen po ni srid pa tha ma'i lus su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: smin pa chen po ni srid pa tha ma'i lus su shes par bya ste /
translated: The great stage of complete maturation should be understood as the body in the final existence,

analyzed: gang la gnas nas lam bskyed par nus pa'o //

original: rnam par dag pa dang nye ba'i rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dang nye ba'i rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the two aspects of purification and proximity,

analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúnirvana in this very life,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan gyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
translated: The attainment of nirvana by others is that of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: nyan thos kyi thos pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi thos pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe ≈õrƒÅvakas attain nirvana through hearing,‚Äù and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni dngos po med pa mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni dngos po med pa mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: For the bodhisattvas, it is the manifest complete enlightenment of the absence of entities.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: theg pa chen pos mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattvas attain nirvana through the MahƒÅyƒÅna.‚Äù

original: mos pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sa bon gyi spyi thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de ni mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: mos pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sa bon gyi spyi thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de ni mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: The power of knowledge of various aspirational factors is the knowledge of the general seed of the various aspirational factors that precede the path of seeing.

original: rnam par phye nas mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par phye nas mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: The power of knowledge of various elements is the knowledge of the various elements that are the seeds of the various aspirational factors.

analyzed: khams sna tshogs kyi dbang du byas nas khams sna tshogs kyang rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya'o //
translated: The various elements should be understood as fourfold, based on the various aspirational factors.

original: de la dang po dang gnyis pa ni sa bon de rigs gnyis so //
analyzed: de la dang po dang gnyis pa ni sa bon de rigs gnyis so //

analyzed: de yang rigs gnyis bstan par shes par bya'o //

original: rnam par dag par byar rung ba'i sa bon ni theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i rigs can de /
analyzed: rnam par dag par byar rung ba'i sa bon ni theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i rigs can de /
translated: The seed that is suitable to be purified is the lineage that is included in the three vehicles.

original: de dag kyang mthun ba'i lam dang 'bras bu thob pa ni rigs rnam par dag par rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mthun ba'i lam dang 'bras bu thob pa ni rigs rnam par dag par rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: And those who obtain the concordant path and the result should be posited as having a purified lineage.

original: rnam par dag par byar mi rung ba'i sa bon ni mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag par byar mi rung ba'i sa bon ni mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The seeds that are not suitable to be purified are those of those who are not destined for nirvana.

original: gcig tu 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi snod du gyur pa'i phyir rnam par bya bar mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig tu 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi snod du gyur pa'i phyir rnam par bya bar mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are said to be incapable of being purified because they are the vessel of the suffering of samsara.

original: sa bon gyi spyi gang yin pa dang lam gyi spyi mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi spyi gang yin pa dang lam gyi spyi mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the general seeds and the knowledge of the general path are called the power of knowledge of the various dhƒÅtus.

original: rnam par phye nas mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ste /üîΩsngon gyi 'gro ba'i spyod pa'i spyi dran pa nyid ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba @331b mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par phye nas mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ste / sngon gyi 'gro ba'i spyod pa'i spyi dran pa nyid ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba @331b mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the specific is called the power of knowledge of the path that leads to all destinations.üîΩThe mere recollection of the general conduct of former lives is called the power of knowledge of death, transmigration, and rebirth.

original: da ltar gyi dus kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba rab tu phye nas shes pa nyid ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba rab tu phye nas shes pa nyid ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: The knowledge of the specific death, transmigration, and rebirth of the present time is by the power of knowledge of remembering former lives.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ltos na ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ltos na ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: If it is in relation to the future, it is by the power of knowledge of death and rebirth.

original: rnam par grol ba rnams kyi nying mtshams sbyor ba ma byed gang yin pa de ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba rnams kyi nying mtshams sbyor ba ma byed gang yin pa de ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: If it is the non-linking of those who are liberated, it is by the power of knowledge of death and rebirth.

original: sems legs par rnam par grol ba rnams kyi tshe 'di nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa rab tu mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: sems legs par rnam par grol ba rnams kyi tshe 'di nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa rab tu mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: If it is the attainment of nirvana in this very life by those whose minds are well liberated, it is by the power of knowledge of the destruction of defilements.üîΩIt should be understood according to what appears in the sutra itself.

original: mdo nyid las 'di skad du 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdo nyid las 'di skad du 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four fearlessnesses of the Tathagata are as follows: O monks, these four are the four fearlessnesses of the Tathagata.

original: gang dang yang dag par ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam 'cha' zhing zhes bya ba nas seng ge'i sgra sgrogs so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang dang yang dag par ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam 'cha' zhing zhes bya ba nas seng ge'i sgra sgrogs so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Having become endowed with this, the TathƒÅgata, Arhat, Perfectly and Completely Enlightened One, the bull of men, the supreme man, the charioteer of men, the teacher of gods and men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, claims the place of the leader, and so on up to: he roars his lion‚Äôs roar in the assemblies.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa na /
analyzed: nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa na /
translated: When I claim to be a Perfectly and Completely Enlightened One,

original: chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes 'dir chos dang mthun par dge slong ngam bram ze'am /
analyzed: chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes 'dir chos dang mthun par dge slong ngam bram ze'am /
translated: I do not see any ground on which a monk or a brahman,

original: lha'am / bdud dam /
analyzed: lha'am / bdud dam /
translated: a god, a MƒÅra, a BrahmƒÅ, or anyone else in the world could reasonably accuse me, saying:üîΩ‚ÄòWhile claiming to be perfectly and completely enlightened, you have not awakened to these phenomena.‚Äô

original: tshangs pa'am / gzhan sus kyang chos dang mthun par rgol ba'am dran par byed pa'i rgyu ma mthong nas bde ba thob cing mi 'jigs pa thob pas gnas pa 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'am / gzhan sus kyang chos dang mthun par rgol ba'am dran par byed pa'i rgyu ma mthong nas bde ba thob cing mi 'jigs pa thob pas gnas pa 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: Having seen no ground for that, I abide in bliss, in happiness, and in confidence and fearlessness. This is the first.

original: ngas zag pa zad do zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa na zag pa 'di ma zad do zhes bya bar gzhan sus kyang zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te gnyis pa'o //üîΩgang yang ngas nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa gang gsungs pa de dag bsten yang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang snga ma bzhin te gsum pa'o //
analyzed: ngas zag pa zad do zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa na zag pa 'di ma zad do zhes bya bar gzhan sus kyang zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te gnyis pa'o // gang yang ngas nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa gang gsungs pa de dag bsten yang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang snga ma bzhin te gsum pa'o //
translated: When I declare that the outflows are exhausted, no one can say that these outflows are not exhausted.üîΩWhen I declare that the obstacles are obstacles for the disciples, no one can say that they are not obstacles.

original: gang yang ngas nyan thos rnams kyi lam nges par 'byung bar byed pas 'phags pa'i nges par 'byung bas sdug bsngal thams cad zad par byed pa bstan pa ni 'dis nges par 'byung bar byed pa ma yin no zhes gzhan sus kyang zhes bya ba snga ma bzhinüîΩte bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang ngas nyan thos rnams kyi lam nges par 'byung bar byed pas 'phags pa'i nges par 'byung bas sdug bsngal thams cad zad par byed pa bstan pa ni 'dis nges par 'byung bar byed pa ma yin no zhes gzhan sus kyang zhes bya ba snga ma bzhinüîΩte bzhi pa'o //
translated: When I declare that the path of the disciples leads to salvation, that it is the noble salvation which leads to the exhaustion of all suffering, no one can say that it does not lead to salvation.

original: 'khor gyi nang du dam 'cha' ba yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas bdag nyid 'jigs pa med pas 'khor gyi nang du dam 'cha' bar bya zhing /üîΩgsangs @332a * //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du dam 'cha' ba yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas bdag nyid 'jigs pa med pas 'khor gyi nang du dam 'cha' bar bya zhing / gsangs @332a * //
translated: One makes a declaration in the midst of the assembly means that, in terms of the perfection of one's own and others' goals, one makes a declaration in the midst of the assembly with self-confidence.

original: nas dam bca' bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nas dam bca' bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should make a declaration openly, not secretly, is what it means.

original: sems can thams cad kyi gnas las yang dag par 'das pa'i gnas dag bdag nyid kyis rab tu mkhyen nas gzhan dag gis rgal ba'i tshig gi skabs med pas bde ba thob pa la gnas pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gnas las yang dag par 'das pa'i gnas dag bdag nyid kyis rab tu mkhyen nas gzhan dag gis rgal ba'i tshig gi skabs med pas bde ba thob pa la gnas pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Having understood the abodes that transcend all abodes of sentient beings, one abides in the attainment of happiness is the connection.

original: dang po ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin ba ste /
analyzed: dang po ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin ba ste /
translated: The first is not shared with the sravakas,

original: de dag la shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas med pa'i phyir dang / shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad shes pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas med pa'i phyir dang / shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad shes pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have abandoned the obscurations to omniscience and do not have the ability to know all aspects of objects of knowledge.

original: de ltar na shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi dbang du byas nas ni dang po'o //üîΩnyan thos dang thun mong ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar pa ni rnam par grol ba la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi dbang du byas nas ni dang po'o // nyan thos dang thun mong ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar pa ni rnam par grol ba la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the first is from the perspective of the wisdom that is unobstructed with regard to all objects of knowledge.

original: bdag nyid kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i dbang du byas pa la ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i dbang du byas pa la ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is from the perspective of the abandonment of all afflictions by oneself, since liberation is not differentiated in terms of the liberation from the afflictive obstructions that is shared with the sravakas.

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams de'i don du zhugs pa rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam nye bar bstan pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams de'i don du zhugs pa rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam nye bar bstan pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the teaching of the supramundane path for those who have entered the path for the sake of liberation.

original: don gyi go rims kyis 'dir dang po bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyi go rims kyis 'dir dang po bstan pa yin te /
translated: The order of the topics is as follows: here, the first is taught.

original: lam bstan nas lam gyi bar du gcod pa rnams bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas so //
analyzed: lam bstan nas lam gyi bar du gcod pa rnams bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas so //
translated: The second is from the perspective of, having taught the path, one should teach the obstructions to the path.

original: nges par 'byung ba la bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams ni mi mthun pa yin pas gcig tu slang bar bya ba nyid ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams ni mi mthun pa yin pas gcig tu slang bar bya ba nyid ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the teaching of the obstructions to renunciation, since phenomena that obstruct renunciation are discordant and should be abandoned alone.

original: phyi ma gnyis ni lam dang de thob pa'i tshogs kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma gnyis ni lam dang de thob pa'i tshogs kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: The latter two are from the standpoint of the path and the equipment for attaining it.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos bstan pa nyid kyis de yang bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos bstan pa nyid kyis de yang bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And that is also taught by the very teaching of the dharmas that are obstacles.

original: gnas bzhi po 'di dag ni 'gas kyang gzhan du bya bar nus ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gnas bzhi po 'di dag ni 'gas kyang gzhan du bya bar nus ba ma yin pas so //
translated: These four points cannot be altered by anyone.

original: dam bca' ba las gzhan du bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu mtshan med par bstan pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan yang zhes bya ba la gnas snga ma gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad mngon par byang chub pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i gnas dag las phyin ci log tu spyod pa ni ji ltar dam bcas pa las phyin ci log tu kun du 'jug pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba las gzhan du bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu mtshan med par bstan pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan yang zhes bya ba la gnas snga ma gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad mngon par byang chub pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i gnas dag las phyin ci log tu spyod pa ni ji ltar dam bcas pa las phyin ci log tu kun du 'jug pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: In order to show that there is no reason for altering the thesis, he says, ‚Äúnor is there a reason for altering it.‚Äù The two previous points refer to the practice of the opposite of the points of full enlightenment and the destruction of the pollutants.

original: lus la sogs pa'i las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: Because all actions of body, etc. are preceded by wisdom,

original: gnas dang po dag las bzlog nas /
analyzed: gnas dang po dag las bzlog nas /
translated: he reverses the first point

original: 'jug pa'i sems pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems pa med pa'o //
translated: and says, ‚Äúthere is no intention to engage.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pas nye bar bstan pa la snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal ba med pa dang / rigs pa dang 'gal ba med pas gnas phyi ma dag kyang dam bca' ba dang 'gal bar @332b 'jug pa med de rgyu mtshan yang dag par ma gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas nye bar bstan pa la snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal ba med pa dang / rigs pa dang 'gal ba med pas gnas phyi ma dag kyang dam bca' ba dang 'gal bar @332b 'jug pa med de rgyu mtshan yang dag par ma gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Tathagata's teaching is not inconsistent with the former or the latter, and is not inconsistent with reason. Therefore, the later positions are not inconsistent with the thesis, because the reason is not seen to be correct.

original: dge slong bram ze dag gi ni lha'i mig dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong bram ze dag gi ni lha'i mig dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The monks and Brahmins do not have the divine eye.

original: lha dang bdud ni lha'i mig dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang bdud ni lha'i mig dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The gods and demons have the divine eye.

original: de ltar na lha'i mig gis kyang log par 'jug pa yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lha'i mig gis kyang log par 'jug pa yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that even with the divine eye, one sees the incorrect engagement.

original: lha dang bdud ni gzhan gyi sems rig pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang bdud ni gzhan gyi sems rig pa'o //
translated: The gods and demons know the minds of others.

original: de las gzhan dag ni gzhan gyi sems rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan dag ni gzhan gyi sems rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Others do not know the minds of others.

original: de ltar na bdud la sogs pas kyang rgol ba'i rgyu mtshan ma mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bdud la sogs pas kyang rgol ba'i rgyu mtshan ma mthong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the demons and so on do not see the reason for the dispute.

original: dam bcas pa'i gnas las bzlog pa'i rgol pa'i gnas yang dag par ma mthong bas bde ba thob pa dang / mi bsnyengs pa thob pa dang bag tsha ba med pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i gnas las bzlog pa'i rgol pa'i gnas yang dag par ma mthong bas bde ba thob pa dang / mi bsnyengs pa thob pa dang bag tsha ba med pa thob pa yin no //
translated: He has attained happiness, attained fearlessness, and attained the absence of anxiety, because he does not see any grounds for the attack that would refute his thesis.

original: thugs la zhum pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir mi bsnyengs pa nges par thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thugs la zhum pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir mi bsnyengs pa nges par thob pa zhes bya'o //
