original: gang gi cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The verse says:

original: slob dpon med pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa med par yang 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: slob dpon med pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa med par yang 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: Without a teacher, i.e., without being taught by another, he appears.

original: cha phyi ma byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sgom pa la mngon par sbyor ba'i tshul gyis mkhyen pa'i skad cig gcig gis shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes la brten nas ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: cha phyi ma byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sgom pa la mngon par sbyor ba'i tshul gyis mkhyen pa'i skad cig gcig gis shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes la brten nas ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: In the second part, he is devoted to the practice of the factors of enlightenment, and by the method of the instant knowledge of all things, he attains the various concentrations based on the unobstructed knowledge.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: skad cig gcig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bslab pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi phyi ma bag chags thams cad 'joms par nus pa gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bslab pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi phyi ma bag chags thams cad 'joms par nus pa gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: One should train in the instantaneity, etc., and in the vajra-like samadhi, which is the last of all the samadhis and is able to destroy all the habitual tendencies.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /üîΩde'i rjes thogs la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste / de'i rjes thogs la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The vajra-like samadhi is so called because it is like a diamond, which is able to cut through anything.

original: stobs bcu la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams chen por gyur pa rdzogs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams chen por gyur pa rdzogs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Immediately after that, one attains unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and the great perfection of the qualities of a Buddha such as the ten powers is called utter purity.

original: cig car 'thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩde thob pas shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bas thogs pa med pa @334b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cig car 'thob par 'gyur ro // de thob pas shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bas thogs pa med pa @334b zhes bya'o //
translated: One attains them all at once.üîΩBecause of attaining them, one is called unobstructed, since one is liberated from the obscurations to omniscience.

original: nyon mongs ba'i sgrib pa las grol bas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs ba'i sgrib pa las grol bas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One is called stainless, since one is liberated from the obscurations of the afflictions.

original: shes bya la 'jug pa ni des sbyor ba ma byas par yang bzhed pa tsam dang 'brel par 'jug go //
analyzed: shes bya la 'jug pa ni des sbyor ba ma byas par yang bzhed pa tsam dang 'brel par 'jug go //
translated: The engagement with objects of knowledge is the engagement with the mere intention of the Buddha, without any effort.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: brtsal ba tsam la thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtsal ba tsam la thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúunimpeded in mere seeking‚Äù

original: mngon par bzhed pa'i don thams cad thob pas brnag pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par bzhed pa'i don thams cad thob pas brnag pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúfulfillment of all aspirations‚Äù because all intended goals are attained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa thob pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa thob pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äútranscending the bodhisattva stages‚Äù because the stage of the TathƒÅgata, which is extremely exalted, is attained.

original: rab tu brtan pa'i sa la gnas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu brtan pa'i sa la gnas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúentering the stage of the TathƒÅgata‚Äù because it abides on the extremely stable stage.

original: snying po la yod pa lta bu'i shes bya'i sgrib pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i gnas ngan len ma lus par spangs pa rten gnas su gyur pa'i mchog thob pa yin no //
analyzed: snying po la yod pa lta bu'i shes bya'i sgrib pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i gnas ngan len ma lus par spangs pa rten gnas su gyur pa'i mchog thob pa yin no //
translated: It is the attainment of the supreme transformation of the basis, which is the complete abandonment of all the negative tendencies that accord with the obscurations to omniscience, which are like the core.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i gnas su gyur pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang / dri ma med pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi skus yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas su gyur pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang / dri ma med pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi skus yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase in its place refers to the fact that it is the basis for the other two bodies. The term unsurpassed is used because the Dharma Body is perfect in all aspects, is free from impurity, and is subsumed within the Dharma Body.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa thams cad la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gong ma gong ma la ltos nas bla na yod pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa thams cad la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gong ma gong ma la ltos nas bla na yod pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The Bodhisattvas who abide in all the stages of the Bodhisattva are said to have a body that is surpassed, in relation to the one that is unsurpassed.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' kha cig kyang mthar thug pa'i sa thob pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' kha cig kyang mthar thug pa'i sa thob pa yin la /
translated: If some Bodhisattvas have attained the ultimate stage,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang mthar thug pa'i sa thob pa yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang mthar thug pa'i sa thob pa yin na /
translated: and the Tathagata has also attained the ultimate stage,

original: de dag la khyad par ni du yod par rig par bya zhes the tshom za bas dris pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag la khyad par ni du yod par rig par bya zhes the tshom za bas dris pa yin la /
translated: how many differences are there between them?

original: spangs pa'i khyad par ni rab tu grags pa nyid do //
analyzed: spangs pa'i khyad par ni rab tu grags pa nyid do //
translated: The difference in their relinquishment is well known.

original: snying po la yod ba lta bu'i shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len rab tu spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: snying po la yod ba lta bu'i shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len rab tu spangs pa yin no //
translated: The example of the cloth with the stain shows the complete abandonment of the negative reflex of the knowable obscurations, as if they were present in the essence.

original: seng ras kyis bar du tshod pa'i dpes ni ji ltar rigs par sgrib pa dang bral ba chen po nyid dang / lhag ma ma lus par spangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: seng ras kyis bar du tshod pa'i dpes ni ji ltar rigs par sgrib pa dang bral ba chen po nyid dang / lhag ma ma lus par spangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin te /
translated: The example of the cloth wrapped in a dirty rag shows the great freedom from obscurations, as is appropriate, and the complete abandonment of the remainder, and thus the illumination of the Tathagata.

original: dpe dang pos sgrib pa med par bstan te /
analyzed: dpe dang pos sgrib pa med par bstan te /
translated: The first example shows the absence of obscurations.

original: phyi mas ni tshon gyi ri mo legs par bkye bas shin tu mdzes pa'i ri mo'i las kyis gsal bar 'gyur zhing 'od gsal ba dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi mas ni tshon gyi ri mo legs par bkye bas shin tu mdzes pa'i ri mo'i las kyis gsal bar 'gyur zhing 'od gsal ba dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes blta bar bya'o //
translated: The second example shows the Tathagata's wisdom, which is like a work of art that is very beautiful because the colors are well applied, and which is illuminated and radiant.

original: mun pa mun nag pa'i nang na blta ba dang / thag ring po nas blta ba dang / de dag las bzlog pa'i dpes kyang gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mun pa mun nag pa'i nang na blta ba dang / thag ring po nas blta ba dang / de dag las bzlog pa'i dpes kyang gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The examples of seeing in the dark, seeing from a distance, and the opposite of those, also show the illumination.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i lus kyi dpes kyang gnas gyur pa chen po nyid bstan pa yin no //üîΩrab @335a * //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i lus kyi dpes kyang gnas gyur pa chen po nyid bstan pa yin no // rab @335a * //
translated: The example of the body, which is and is not born, also shows the great transformation.

original: rib can gyi dpe las bzlog pas ni shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid bstan to //üîΩye shes khyad par che ba ni /
analyzed: rib can gyi dpe las bzlog pas ni shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid bstan to // ye shes khyad par che ba ni /
translated: The example of the man with cataracts shows the extreme purity.üîΩThe superiority of the knowledge

original: ye shes kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par ro //
translated: is the superiority of the knowledge.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bla na med pa'i rten yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bla na med pa'i rten yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is the transformation of the support of the supreme marks and secondary signs of a great person.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sngar bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa bcu bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sngar bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa bcu bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, after the Tathagata fully awakened to enlightenment, the ten activities of the Tathagata should be understood as taught by the power of the dharmas previously explained.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bya ba rnams pa bcus nges par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir le'u bcus bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bya ba rnams pa bcus nges par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir le'u bcus bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha dharmas are taught by ten chapters in order to definitely accomplish the ten activities.

original: de dag gi yul yang rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi yul yang rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to extensively teach their objects,

original: phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the verse that goes in the ten directions, and so on,

original: dang po nyid du ni nyid kyi skus mngon par yid ches pa bskyed nas dad par mdzad ba yin no //
analyzed: dang po nyid du ni nyid kyi skus mngon par yid ches pa bskyed nas dad par mdzad ba yin no //
translated: first, by his own body, he generates confidence and makes them faithful.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba las de las gzhan pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba las de las gzhan pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi bya ba yin no //
translated: That is the activity of the other disciples, preceded by that.

original: de yang sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa la mos pa'i dbang gis sems can rnams la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa la mos pa'i dbang gis sems can rnams la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, by the body adorned with the major and minor marks, the Tathagata appears to sentient beings by the power of their devotion to the Tathagata.

original: de yang kha cig gis ni brgya byin gyi gzugs su mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas so //
analyzed: de yang kha cig gis ni brgya byin gyi gzugs su mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas so //
translated: Following the sutra, some see him in the form of Indra.

original: de ltar sems 'dun par byas pa la cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis gdams pa'i sbyor ba ni gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems 'dun par byas pa la cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis gdams pa'i sbyor ba ni gnyis pa ste /
translated: Thus, in those whose minds are inclined, the application of instruction by the three miracles is the second,

original: de dag rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa la sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa la sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: the application to the complete purity of all aspects.

original: de ltar gdams pa byas pas bya ba thams cad byed pa la nus pa dang ldan par byas nas mi shes pas kun du rmongs pa dang / the tshom gyi shes pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi the tshom gcod par nus pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gdams pa byas pas bya ba thams cad byed pa la nus pa dang ldan par byas nas mi shes pas kun du rmongs pa dang / the tshom gyi shes pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi the tshom gcod par nus pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: Thus, having made one capable of performing all actions, the third is the ability to eliminate the doubts of those who have a confused understanding due to ignorance and those who have a doubting understanding.

original: de yang stobs bcu dang ldan par shes par bya zhing rig phar bya ste ;
analyzed: de yang stobs bcu dang ldan par shes par bya zhing rig phar bya ste ;
translated: Moreover, it should be understood and recognized as possessing the ten powers,

original: de dag ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are of the nature of knowledge.

original: pha rol rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa dang / rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa dang / rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the ability to defeat all adversaries and to establish one's own position,

original: de ni mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses the four forms of fearlessness.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rim gyis bstan pa la zhugs pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rim gyis bstan pa la zhugs pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The fifth is the ability to engage in teaching in the manner that has been taught,üîΩbecause it possesses the four forms of unhindered knowledge.

original: sems can kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid ni lnga pa ste /
analyzed: sems can kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid ni lnga pa ste /
translated: The sixth is the ability to eliminate the passions of all sentient beings,üîΩbecause it possesses great compassion.

original: tshogs yongs su sdud pa'i sgo nas 'dren pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs yongs su sdud pa'i sgo nas 'dren pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the leader because he is endowed with the mindfulness that gathers the assemblies.

original: bsam pa dang sbyor ba ma 'dres pas /üîΩji skad smras pa ni drug pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor ba ma 'dres pas / ji skad smras pa ni drug pa ste /
translated: He is the one who speaks as he does because he is endowed with the intention and application that are not mixed up.

original: de la srung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la srung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the one who does what he says because he is endowed with the absence of watchfulness.

original: nyin mtshan du sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten @335b thams cad la rnam par gzigs pa ni bdun pa ste /üîΩde ni thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems can thams cad kyi bya ba mi 'dor zhing sems can gyi bya ba thams cad la nye bar gnas pa'i dran pa dang ldan pa nyid ni brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: nyin mtshan du sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten @335b thams cad la rnam par gzigs pa ni bdun pa ste / de ni thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // sems can thams cad kyi bya ba mi 'dor zhing sems can gyi bya ba thams cad la nye bar gnas pa'i dran pa dang ldan pa nyid ni brgyad pa ste /
translated: He is the one who sees the entire world with the eye of a Buddha day and night because he is endowed with great compassion.

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang gnas pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su sgrub pa ni dgu pa ste /
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir ro // de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang gnas pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su sgrub pa ni dgu pa ste /
translated: He is the one who is endowed with the mindfulness that does not abandon the activities of all sentient beings and that is present for all the activities of sentient beings because he is endowed with the nature of nonforgetfulness.

original: de ni bag chags yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bag chags yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the one who practices in accordance with the conduct and way of life of the TathƒÅgatas because he is endowed with the destruction of the traces.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du don ma yin pa ston pa spangs nas don du 'gyur ba nye bar ston par byed pa ni bcu pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du don ma yin pa ston pa spangs nas don du 'gyur ba nye bar ston par byed pa ni bcu pa ste /
translated: The tenth is the teaching of what is meaningful, having abandoned the teaching of what is not meaningful, just as it is.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog mkhyen pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog mkhyen pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is endowed with the knowledge of all aspects and the supreme aspects.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos bcu tshan 'dis bsdus pa la rab tu phye nas mdzad pa rnam pa bcur 'byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos bcu tshan 'dis bsdus pa la rab tu phye nas mdzad pa rnam pa bcur 'byed do //
translated: Thus, having distinguished the tenfold activity of the buddhas by way of these ten groups of ten dharmas,

original: mdzad pa re re'i bya ba yang sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pas tshad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa re re'i bya ba yang sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pas tshad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: the activity of each of the ten should be understood as immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the realm of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam grangs gcad par bya ba sla ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam grangs gcad par bya ba sla ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is not easy to enumerate these, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa 'di dag kho na la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa dang rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa 'di dag kho na la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa dang rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: These very stations of the tathagatas are called the tathagata stage and the well-established stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i lam gyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad de la rab tu gnas nas de don du gnyer ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i lam gyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad de la rab tu gnas nas de don du gnyer ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Because it is the basis of the bodhisattva path of training for all bodhisattvas, and because all bodhisattvas, having well-abided in it, strive for its goal.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa thams cad la slob pa na zhes bya bas sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa thams cad la slob pa na zhes bya bas sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, when the bodhisattva is training in all the trainings, because it is the basis for accomplishing the aims of all sentient beings,

original: rab tu gnas pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa gnas nas sems can thams cad kyi don yang dag par sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa gnas nas sems can thams cad kyi don yang dag par sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: the Tathagata, having well-abided in that well-abiding, accomplishes the aims of all sentient beings.

original: des na rab tu gnas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na rab tu gnas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called well-abiding.

original: 'di dag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to show just these as the unshared qualities of the Buddha, it says, All these qualities of the Buddha... and so forth.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba la nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don bya ba dang mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba la nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don bya ba dang mthun pa yin la /
translated: Because they are endowed with the ability to act for the welfare of sentient beings, they are conducive to the welfare of others.

original: gcig tu gzhan gyi don byed pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu gzhan gyi don byed pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are distinguished by their single-minded performance of the welfare of others.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams ni de lta bu las bzlog pa yin pas de dag la chos 'di dag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams ni de lta bu las bzlog pa yin pas de dag la chos 'di dag med pa'i phyir /
translated: The sravakas, etc., are the opposite of that. Therefore, these dharmas do not exist in them.

original: des na sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called the unshared qualities of the Buddha.

translated: When one is engaged in the practice of benefiting oneself and others, the means of avoiding afflictions, the means of not becoming weary, the means of increasing the roots of virtue, and the means of attaining Awakening, one should first of all develop conviction in the profound and extensive teachings.

original: de la mos na chos de dag yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: de la mos na chos de dag yongs su tshol lo //

analyzed: de ltar bstan bcos shes shing 'jig rten shes na tshul bzhin du chos rnams yongs su tshol bar byed do //

analyzed: bdag nyid kyang shes pas mngon par skye bas ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa de ni bsgrubs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / phan yon gyi khyad par gyis sems can thams cad dag /

translated: and also to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, because of the excellence of his practice and the excellence of his benefit.

original: de la bsgrubs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa dang / gzhan gyi don rang gis dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: de la bsgrubs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa dang / gzhan gyi don rang gis dgos pa yin te /
translated: The excellence of his practice is that the bodhisattva has entered in order to benefit both himself and others, and the benefit of others is his own purpose.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni de ltar gzhan gyi don bdag gis dgos pa ma yin no //

original: sems snyoms pas na rtag tu phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhugs la /
analyzed: sems snyoms pas na rtag tu phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhugs la /
translated: Because of his impartiality, he has entered in order to always benefit them.

original: lan du phan 'dogs pa la yang re ba med do //
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs pa la yang re ba med do //
translated: He does not expect to be repaid for his help.

original: de ltar brtson pa ni rtag tu de la phan pa dang bde bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa ni rtag tu de la phan pa dang bde bar 'dod do //
translated: Thus, he always desires their benefit and happiness.

original: de ltar phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni de dag la 'bras bu yod par sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de ltar phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni de dag la 'bras bu yod par sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Thus, one who has the thought of benefit and happiness applies himself to the existence of their result.

analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni gong nas gong du bsgrubs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bsgrubs so //
translated: Thus, he establishes the special qualities of the accomplishment of the higher and higher.

analyzed: de la phan yon gyi yon tan gyi khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas rnams las lung bstan pa thob kyi //
translated: Therein, the special quality of the benefit is that the Bodhisattva receives the prophecy from the Buddhas,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ma yin no //

original: lung bstan nas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lung bstan nas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Having received the prophecy, he abides in the stage of non-regression.

analyzed: de la gnas na nges par bya ba dang rtag tu bya dgos pa la brjed ba med pa'i chos nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Abiding therein, he obtains the nature of non-forgetfulness with regard to what is to be done and what is always to be done.

original: de ltar brjed pa med pa'i chos nyid thob par gyur pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gdags pa la 'dogs par mdzad do //

translated: Having thus obtained the nature of non-forgetfulness, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas designate him as the foremost of all beings.

original: bya ba thams cad dang yongs su nyams par mi byed de /
analyzed: bya ba thams cad dang yongs su nyams par mi byed de /
translated: He does not allow any of his activities to decline.

original: ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not allow himself to decline through the loss of what has been attained.

original: yongs su ma nyams na rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i chos rnams kyis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su ma nyams na rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i chos rnams kyis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he does not allow himself to decline, he is always and uninterruptedly born in a good destiny,

original: zla ba yar gyi ngo bzhin du skye ba na yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba yar gyi ngo bzhin du skye ba na yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpar 'gyur te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ltar bcos ma ma yin no //

analyzed: yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpar gyur na rnam pa thams cad du gdul ba'i thabs thams cad shes so //
translated: When he becomes a true bodhisattva, he knows all the methods for training all the types of disciples.

original: shes par gyur na gang las yongs su btsal dang / gang yongs su btsal ba dang / gang gis yongs su btsal ba rnam par gzhag pa thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes par gyur na gang las yongs su btsal dang / gang yongs su btsal ba dang / gang gis yongs su btsal ba rnam par gzhag pa thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he knows them, he becomes skilled in all the principles of what is to be sought, what is to be sought, and by whom it is to be sought.

original: yongs su btsal ba yang gang gis mthar thug par 'gyur ba de rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su btsal ba yang gang gis mthar thug par 'gyur ba de rnam par 'jog par byed do //

analyzed: rnam bar gzhag pa la mkhas na gdams ngag la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is skilled in the presentation of the Dharma, one will be skilled in the instructions.

original: gdams ngag la mkhas na dmigs pa tshad med ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdams ngag la mkhas na dmigs pa tshad med ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is skilled in the instructions, one will attain the king of samƒÅdhis, which has immeasurable objects.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de thob pas 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: By attaining that samƒÅdhi, one will teach the Dharma that has results.

translated: One will also attain certainty in the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung na theg pa chen po sdud par yang 'gyur ro //

translated: If one attains certainty in the MahƒÅyƒÅna, one will also gather the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang thun mong du gyur pa'i ming 'dogs shing bstod par yang mdzad de /

analyzed: de lta bu'i ming can de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtags rnams yin te /
translated: These are the signs of a bodhisattva who has such a name.
